The deal breaker between choosing the two was that My Tofu House didn't serve soju haha so Han Il Kwan it is. We came for lunch and there were many open tables so we sat right away with no wait.

This was my second visit here, but I still have yet to use the bbq grill where you cook your own meat. Last time I got a bbq beef bibimbab in the hot stone pot because I like my rice crispy. The egg the serve is always a perfect sunny side up to crack and mix all into the bowl, but it was a little skimp on the meat.

This time around my bf and I decided to get spicy pork and bulgolgi, which they cook for you if you opt out of grilling it yourself. The meats are the same price no matter which option you choose, but the bbq grill requires a minimum of 2 meats. It is on the pricier side for about ~$22 a plate, but from what I remember that's at least cheaper than Brother's on Geary.

The meat plates come with banchan, rice and their house egg soup but I decided to order tofu soup also. Before we even placed our order, the waiter dropped off their potato pancakes on the house which came with 2 mini ones. The spicy pork plate came out quickly after and once we were a few shots of soju in (no fruity soju cocktails here), we were grubbing and realized that we already had so much food at our table.

The spicy pork was piled with so much meat that we started to think if they brought out the bulgolgi, it'd be too much food. I checked in with one of the waiters and she looked confused as if they never even put in an order for the bulgolgi. Good thing we felt that our order on the table was enough so I just told her to cancel it. It was most likely a miscommunication because we had multiple servers taking our order, checking on us and bringing out the food so they must have had a misunderstanding.

Besides the little mishap, everything was very enjoyable and tasty. The pork was well marinated and thoroughly cooked. The tofu soup could have been a little spicier, but the tofu, beef and mushrooms in the soup were all soft and comforting to eat. It is worth making the drive into the Richmond when craving kbbq! But I will try to limit my visits for only lunch hours as I hear it gets really packed for dinner.
author: Georgina G.

description:
Hello.... HELLO! This place is one of the BEST kbbq I've ever tried in my life... I'm from Philadelphia and we do not get this much meat when we order kalbi. Not just the portion but it was just really well marinated. All of the side dishes really satisfied my soul! We also got bibimbap and cold noodle but definitely... kalbi is a must!

I must add though.... the service wasn't great. I am not complaining tho...!
author: Saemyi J.

description: You're probably scrolling through all these reviews and contemplating on whether the hour or so wait is worth, I am gonna tell you yes.  I waited an hour for a party of 6 on a Saturday night and we were not disappointed. We did the family dinner for 6 and it was amazing. There was a lot of variety for the price. Not to mention the steamed egg was a larger portion than normal. (I love steamed eggs)The Galbi was not overly marinaded which I liked and pork belly is always good. There was so many dishes-im not gonna go through it all. They were all bomb. The servers were all very kind and quick. I do recommend doing reservations and unfortunately they don't do same day reservations.
author: Kimmie H.

description:
We came here around 8:30PM and there was a wait for tables with BBQ. However, we opted for a regular table. There were three of us and they offered complementary dishes (about 10) of banchan. My favorites were the pickled daikon and cucumber. They also offered tofu soup which was served in a stone pot and piping hot! More likely than not, you will be ordering TOO much food. 

I got the bimbap in a stone pot which was OK. All the ingredients were fresh and it came out extremely hot. The pot kept the food hot and eventually, the rice on the bottom was getting burnt. However, I definitely recommend getting this to share! 
We also got the prawns with vegetables (zucchini, carrots, onions) which was served in this slightly spicy red sauce. The prawns were perfectly cooked and it was delicious.

Service was quick and efficient. This is a solid Korean place to enjoy with a group of people!
author: Carol W.

description:
Sadly I have to give this place 1 star because of the way the locals are being treated. 
This restaurant serves tour buses of people nightly, which is totally fine - but when you've waited 45 mins patiently for a table only to be given the back handed treatment and ignored once a tour bus arrives - i think this no longer will be my favorite korean spot. Then we were told we will be seated after the tour bus group is done eating. Are you kidding me? I've already waited for 45 mins. And I came EARLY. Not prime dinner time - but at 5pm! 

If the restaurant prefers the business of people that are not locals..that's fine by me. There are plenty of good local restaurants around. They are not the only korean food joint around.
author: Betty S.

description:
Very solid KBBQ. It's not AYCE but the portions are pretty solid for the prices. The meats are marinated very well and the cuts are very tender, so there isn't much opportunity for screwing up when grilling. The banchan selection is quite large as well, and I really love that you get a free tofu soup for the table with the bbq orders, which is also very tasty and fulfilling by itself. 

Wait times are definitely long so try to make reservations. Service wasn't the best on our most recent visit due to how busy it was, but it's understandable. We had to be pretty persistent in calling staff over to get more banchan or tea. Otherwise, it was a really great meal.
author: Tony D.

description:
This is one of my absolute favoritest Korean places!!!!! Not that I know of very many but probably because this is just amazing already that I believe the search is over!!!!

The customer service is not excellent or amazingly fantabulous but it's definitely pretty wonderful. The food was put on the table within minutes.

Jap chae, beef, soup, pork, spicy chicken, "pancakes" (?), mackerel, steamed egg, bibimbap. All deliciously wonderful!!!! I didn't particularly care for the mackerel though - it was pretty dry.

I just have nothing really bad to say about this place at all!!!!
author: Athena C.

description:
We came here for a late lunch and luckily did not have to wait in line! The rice cake in spicy sauce was pretty average and spicy, decent sized. The bibimbap was also pretty average in quality, but filling. The tofu soup and side dishes were good. Average but good Korean food.

Would want to try the Korean BBQ next time!
author: Angel G.

description:
I have been eating here ever since I was little and I love the food. I usually order the Gal-Bi and the Gal-Bi-Jjim (Braised beef short rib with potatoes and carrots). Then everything else we order usually depends on our mood at the time. 
I love their ban chan, there are a lot of great variety in their ban chan and they offer lettuce wraps. I love wrapping my gal-bi in the lettuce wrap and putting some of the soy bean paste.
I love how this place shows their authenticity. When I want real korean food this is where I go.

Other than the food, I would never go here. The food is to die for. There is maybe one server that actually cares about their customers and their needs. But all the rest of the servers are literally the worst servers I have ever met.
I can never meet the eye of any servers as they are always avoiding eye contact. I can never get anything without asking for it about 2-4 times. 
I feel like the servers here hate the customers and it really shows. I wish the customer service here was as good as it used to be back when I was a kid and used to come here with my family.

Ever since the past few experiences here, my family and I never go here. We are sick of always waiting at least 15 minutes waving a server down to get something we already asked for. Whenever there is a mistake with our order, instead of an apology, most of the time they make a mean face at us as if it was our fault.

Han Il Kwan, I used to live going to your restaurant. But now this is one of those sad restaurants that I will probably never visit because of the horrible service. I understand food service is hard, I work as a server as well, but don't mean you have to make your customers feel uncomfortable eating.
author: Ariunaa B.

description: SO TASTY! Korean BBQ that did not disappoint. So many flavor profiles, sure to keep your tastebuds happy. All of the pickled side dishes complimented each one of the meats so well. Gal-bi-marinated beef short ribs(MUST order) highly recommended!! All around great customer service- the waitress basically cooked our "self-cooked" meal for us. We will be back
author: L N.

description:
I think I've found my new go-to Korean restaurant in the city!

PROS:
-GRILLED MACKEREL, holy Jesus. I left wanting more...and even licking my fingers trying to taste it. It was extremely moist, with a light salty, lemony flavor..reminding me a lot of hamachi kama. I stopped talking after I took my first bite. ORDER THIS.
-Complimentary green onion pancakes and choice of steamed egg or beef soft tofu soup for the table.
-Large variety of banchan. They give the little baby fish, which I love!
-Sweet rice drink at the end of the meal!
-Kalbi lunch portion was super juicy, and came with a pretty big portion of meat. The marinade was really good, not too sweet.
-Kimchee stew was really good and the soup had a nice, sour, cabbagy taste to it and wasn't too spicy. Perfect alternative to pho on a cold night!

The ONLY CON:
-The oxtail soup. I was totally looking forward to this since I LOOOOVE oxtail, but it was completely bland. It tasted like boiled oxtail bones. With clear, bland noodles. We added a good amount of salt, but it couldn't save the soup. Skip!
-Oh... And parking absolutely sucks here.
author: Vivian C.

description: This place is ALWAYS packed!! But service is great and the food is excellent so I can see why.  My friend and I shared the spicy pork bbq and braised ox tail with potatoes and carrots.  Both dishes were really good and the sides were great too!  The spicy pork wasn't excessively fatty and the braised oxtail soup goes really great with rice.  It was a bit sweet, but still good.  (I'm not a fan of sweets).
author: Jonathan W.

description:
YES!!!! Finally! A Korean BBQ restaurant that is affordable and down right delicious! I've gone years without having a go-to Korean restaurant nearby and I'm happy to find the winner! Han II Kwan!

Since my first visit 6 months ago, I've dined here 3 times! Now, that's a solid number! What I like most about Han II Kwan is that it's not AYCE, but you can still grill the meat yourself. (Note, you must order a minimum of 2 orders of meat if you would like to grill it yourself. )

Sometimes, I just don't feel like being a carnivore and stuffing my mouth with meat and more meat for $30+ at all you can eat buffets so this is my solution..

++ Order a single order of meat, because it's the perfect portion for a party of two.  (Try- Bulgogi, Kalbi, or Spicy Pork)
++ Stuff your face with the plethora of above average tasting banchan (My fave-kimchi and fish cake)
++ Take Advantage of the "On the House" perks (Rice, egg, tofu soup, and get this, even dessert!)

Note: Come here for lunch! (M-F until 4pm)
author: Briana H.

description:
I chose this place because I needed to treat a few family members to a post X'mas dinner. I frequently visit Korean restaurants in the South Bay and the Fremont area.  
Overall the food were only of average quality, but the service was sub par. The restaurant was so understaffed that finding any waitress was a challenge. They mixed up our orders,  and at times brought us dishes from other tables. Just confusing and lack of organization. If my family members didn't have to travel on Uber,  I would have definitely choose a different Korean restaurant.
author: Alfred C.

description: I love this Korean restaurant it is my favorite Korean restaurant of all time so I've been coming here since I was 10 years old so I have been eating here for over two decades and the food is just so amazing the stuff or so friendly it's clean the food comes out right away and they always have so much size to choose from.
author: Michele T.

description: One of the better korean bbq spots in the area. They have limited bbq tables which can make the wait long sometimes but if you dont mind having them cook the meat and bring it out the wait here isnt bad. You can tell the place is good when a good number of koreans frequent the place. The food is solid. I've had the galbi, bulgogi, and spicy pork bulgogi and they are all seasoned/marinated well. The meat is tender and not chewy. Their banchan/sides are plentiful and delicious. The seafood pancake here is one of the best i've had in the area, they don't skimp of the seafood and actually give you a fair amount. Also the pancake is served up crisp as it should be and has a nice crunch around the edges. Service here can be hit or miss but i find that its pretty normal for a typical korean place. One f my go to places when i have a craving for korean bbq
author: Peter P.

description: Came here with my sister and friend while in SF.  The foods here are average.  Pancake is not crispy outside and cook through inside.  The meats are average and the ones with marinades are so-so.  Soft tofu soup is also average.  Side dishes are nothing special.  Service was okay.  I get better Korean foods in Houston.  Really disappointed in the foods here.
author: Kayla N.

description:
I came here with a group of 5 (including myself). The waitress started us off with mung bean cake on the house! Then came the ban chan. It was a bigger variety then what other Korean restaurants out there give. 

For the main dishes, we ordered the tofu soup, bi bim bap, seafood pancake, and the beef noodle soup. 

-tofu soup: no flavor, very bland
- bi bim bap: delicious
- seafood pancake: green onions were too long which made eating it difficult 
- beef noodle soup: not too much noodles, but the soup was not bad 

The waitress also gave us a steamed egg on the house. Honestly, I think that was the best dish out of all the dishes we had. 

Service was okay. Had to flag them down for my water to be refilled a few times. Also, not as many people in here as expected.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
We love this place!!!  Jun and his staff are the best!  We use to live in the Avenues and would get a large group together once a month. This was when they had the charcoal grills in the far back room. 
We don't go out that way as often anymore but when we do, Jun is always very welcoming.   Now we get the food grilled for us and it's still always a great experience. Great food, drinks and friendly staff. 
 We LOVE you Jun!
author: Rhonnie R.

description: Came here for dinner with the boyfriend, and we loved it! First of all, they give you so many complementary dishes! There's tea and tons of little apps. Only thing is ding this place on is service- the servers were very attentive and would take empty plates and things from the table very promptly, but before we ordered or had gotten any food, we asked our server how much food would be enough for 2 people, and she just replied, I don't know how much you eat... so we ended up ordering 2 meats to BBQ and 2 other dishes, which with all of that free stuff as well was way too much food! Don't get me wrong, we loved the leftovers, but still a little guidance for first-timers would've been nice. We did however love all of the food we ordered. We got the spicy bulgogi and marinated chicken for meats, and we also got the soft tofu soup and kimchi with veggies and pork. Our favorite was definitely the spicy bulgogi, but everything else was awesome as well. For the best value, we figured if we come back we'd skip the BBQ stuff (the meats are on the pricier side), and we'd be okay getting 2 dishes to split between us. Overall, would definitely come back again, and remember when you're ordering that you'll get a ton of free food as well!
author: Rachel D.

description: everytime i come here, i have to prep by fasting myself. DEFINITELY WORTH YOUR MONEY. food is great and at a solid price point. hell, they even bring the korean tourists here ; let that sink in a little bit.
author: Jack L.

description:
We eat off hours so got seating immediately, ban chan with free refill was nice.
1 meat dish and 1 bi bim bap was just right for 2 people, and wash it down with an included sweet rice drink at the end.   $48 + tip
The kitchen was hectic when we left, because by then the tour bus arrived at around 5p
The place is quite big beside with an expanded seating at the back where they accommodate the tourist crowd.
Restrooms are clean and adequately equipped.
author: Drew B.

description:
Best kbbq restaurant I can find here in the Bay Area. I'm very satisfied. As a Chinese that loves Korean food more than Chinese food, ive been to so many Korean restaurants and would drive to LA's ktown just for the food there. I'm very picky about food quality and variations. This place definitely meets my expectations and I'll come back over and over again.

I came with three other guys, and we got the set menu for 6 for $140. We were amazed by the food combination, side dishes, and the meat quality.
author: Kaiyan Z.

description: Fabulous service, ample banchan, loved the corn ad cheese on the grill. Very satisfied.
author: Robin S.

description: My wife and I are always looking for THE best Korean restaurant in SF. It's a search for the Holy Grail for us. Well, we found it - Han Il Kwan in Richmond is incredible.  The appetizers are all delicious and bountiful.  Most Korean restaurants provide a few good appetizers mixed in with the not-so-good variety.  And, they are skimpy with the quantity of the appetizers, called ban-chan.  Here, all of the ban-chan are awesome.  The main dishes were just out of this world.  We had the BBQ beef and various stews.  Just awesome. Ahhhhhhh.
author: Anthony K.

description:
If you have a small appetite like me, order something to share. I definitely got way too full before my main course came because of all the delicious side dishes.

Every table gets complimentary rice, unlimited side dishes (you can ask for seconds), and either soft tofu soup or steamed egg. Knowing this, I should've ordered something to share but I didn't. We are definitely both regretting that decision right now.

I got the jap chae (vermiccili noodles with beef and veggies) and really liked it. They also have Korean BBQ if that's what you wanna go for.

My only complaint: they made us wait so long for a table because only kbbq tables were free and we weren't gonna do bbq. Which seems pretty silly to me.
author: Vivian W.

description: Really great korean food with fast and friendly service. Very limited parking but worth coming back.
author: Ralph K.

description: Came here because of the reviews and glad I did.  My bf and I can smell the bbq one block away and it smell so good.  The service was quick and the food was good.  They gave us some rice dessert drink.  First I didn't want to try it but my bf said it was good. I tried and it was very good.  I will definitely come back again.
author: Van F.

description:
One of the few authentic korean places in sf. You know when it's authentic when you see korean tour buses stop by this restaurant for their lunches/dinners -- I've seen a bunch of korean tour groups stop by this restaurant to eat.

Had their kalbi, kimchi fried pancakes, dolsot bibimbap, tofu soup, and bunch of other stuff and they were all satisfying and delicious.
author: Erika S.

description: This place was amazing. I'm just traveling from the mid west. The spicy pork was to die for. The service was amazing. I don't leave reviews, but I was so impressed that I had to. It's inexpensive and I was so happy. We told them it was our first time to this restraunt and they brought out a complementary egg dish. If you're in the area this place is a must
author: James G.

description:
My taste buds are still on fire (in a great way). As soon as we walked in, I knew by the number of grandmothers there we had made the right choice.

Finding parking was a disaster, but that comes from someone who doesn't live in San Francisco.  We managed and we are glad we did.

The tofu soup is a nice touch for lunch along with the rice drink. The banchan was absolutely awesome and they didn't dial the heat down on the Daegi Bulgogi. In Denver, they usually whiten it up a bit (less spice and more sugar). This one made me pleasantly sweat.

The service was great and they smiled graciously when I butchered Thank You in Korean. I will be back!!!
author: Big Daddy H.

description:
Some of the best Korean food we've had in SF!

Overall, great food, good service, not cheap, but worth the price and wait. Expect long wait times if coming after 5:30 pm on a Friday or Saturday night

Wait times: 3/5
We came at around 4:45 pm on a Saturday. Be warned!! They serve lots of tour groups on Friday and Saturday evenings that take up about 80% of the restaurant. We waited about 40 minutes for our table. But it was worth it!

Taste: 5/5
We tried the sautéed pork and bi bim bap, both of which were delicious. The pork wasn't too spicey and was very tender. The bi bim bap had a perfect mix of veggies and beef. 

Quantity: 5/5
The quantity given is very fair for the price. Each table gets rice, a variety of side dishes (about 7 in total) and a choice of tofu soup or steamed rice. They give you roasted barley tea as well. It doesn't look like a lot when you first see it but combined with the dishes you order you'll most likely have leftovers. At the end of the meal, they will give you a sugary rice drink. 

Price: 4/5
Not cheap but not super expensive by SF standards. For the both of us for those 2 dishes it came out to be around $35. 

Service: 5/5
Very attentive, friendly, and timely given how busy they were.
author: Alice L.

description:
It was ok. 
The menu was a bit small compared to most places. 
The kimchi/seafood pancake was too oily and thick, & lacked both kim chi & seafood flavor, mostly tasted of deep fried oily egg...
Also it doesn't come w sides which is the main reason I go out for Korean so I ordered them extra. They were also ok. 
Not memorable. 
Service was fine, friendly and quick.
author: Nilu r.

description: Went to dinner with my parents here for Father's Day. Ordered a couple of dishes including the soondubu, beef jjigae, seafood pancake, and Kalbi jjim. The tofu soondubu was pretty bland and didn't have any egg in it. Other than that, all the dishes were excellent, well priced and fresh. The kalbi jjim was by far the best. The beef was so tender and sweet. And I have to mention - the side dishes that come complementary were super good. They rotate the types of dishes they give out here. When I went, we even get some sautéed chicken as a free side dish. Without us asking, the waiter also brought us a free claypot steamed egg.  I would highly recommend the place to anyone looking for some authentic Korean food in the Bay Area.
author: Jackie C.

description:
This place is a total Yelp hype. While the food is not all that bad, it's not all that good either. If you are looking for Korean food - it will satisfy the craving in a pinch but I've had better. I must admit though,I'm really picky because I have Korean food quite often.

The place is not that big but it's pretty and clean. They'll ask you right away if you want to do Korean bbq or regular food. I opted for the Korean bbq. It was a Monday night but it was full. Parking in the area is a pain though and there were definitely police officers writing tickets.

I tried the kalbi, bulgogi, seafood pancake, and spicy rice cake. The kalbi was cut down differently than the kalbi I normally have. Normally it's sliced thinly across the bones, so you end up with a strip of meat with a couple pieces of bone. Imagine baby back ribs but cut perpendicular against the bone. Theirs is more like an English rib with the layers of meat fileted and a giant bone for the end piece. 

The reason why I'm bothering to mention this is because I think the cut impacts the marinating and flavoring. Thinner cuts usually need less time to marinate for maximum flavor. Their meats altogether was just bland. 

The rice cake was ok. It was just rice cake - no fish or egg or even scallion added. Yet another bland dish. The sea food pancake was probably the best dish and had a lot of filling. They did give you a lot of side dishes and some tofu soup though.

All in all, I would come back if I don't feel like making my own Korean food but in such a big city, I feel like there must be more options. I wouldn't know though,  first time in the area myself.
author: Joey R.

description: The best Korean food I've had in San Francisco. They served us eight side dishes, all fresh and crisp, and even a tofu soup on the house that had many chunks of beef and flavorful soup. We had bibimbap which was great by itself and even better when accompanied by the side dishes. The sweet rice drink at the end was a little too sweet (I usually drink it with no added sugar), but still refreshing and a generous gesture from the restaurant.
author: Yoko S.

description:
This is my FAVORITE Korean restaurant. I always order the spicey pork and seafood scallion pancake. The dumpling rice cake soup is delicious too. They're pretty generous with the ban chan. 

Best to make reservations or you will probably need to wait. They serve tour buses all the time. Still worth the wait.
author: MC C.

description:
Terrible service.
Amazing food.
Food always wins.
Will be back and gladly take any abuse they dish out.
author: Sally H.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the spicy pork (with complimentary tofu soup), steamed egg, and bibimbap skillet. Total with tip was close to $60 but they were generous with the portion. 

Service was 2/5. The ladies hardly catered to us. 

Steamed egg was 3/5. I love eggs and I was very disappointed with this. I don't think they added salt at all. I added salt on my own. 

Spicy pork + tofu soup was 2/5. Pork was kind of dry yet pretty flavorful. Tofu soup was watered down. Still kind of tasty. 

Lastly, the bibimbap skillet was 3/5. It wasn't anything to go crazy for but I liked it enough. 

Go here if you never had Korean food. I'm from LA where Korean foods are flavorful and packed with punch. This restaurant is more for people with sensitive taste buds or people who are new to Korean food imo. 

Also, come early as 75% of the tables were already reserved when we came here past 4pm.
author: Michelle K.

description: The food is fantastic! Quantity, quality, prices are all good as well. I highly recommend going here for Korean food; of the places I've tried, Han Il Kwan takes the cake. I will be coming here often.
author: Christine Y.

description:
We went here because some friends wanted Korean food. And it was a great choice. They recommended their spicy cold noodle and it was just delicious. Never had anything like it haha. I wish they had some kimchi fried rice but it's okay. They have grills for self bbq but you have to order to meat dishes, but if not you can always have them grill it for you to. 

I also really like how at the end of your meal they serve you a small desert drink that consist of sweet rice. Pretty good place to try. Even better during lunch.
author: Herman L.

description:
I know this place can be a little annoying with the parking situation. The constant stream of Korean tourist being corralled in and out on a daily bases like a large herd of hungry cattle. And while the service can be measured on a scale of good to sometimes pretty bad. Han il Kwan is pretty much the best korean restaurant in SF hands down because of the food. 
This place has been around as long as I can remember. When my family and I can to SF from Busan Korea....my Mom's first job was as a waitress here in the late 80's. So you can say, I pretty much grew up eating here all my life. (She's not working there anymore.) The services would be excellent if she was. Lol
Anyways, owners have changed but the food still remains pretty close to home cooked, authentic korean cuisines. My favs are the Ahl chigae, (fish egg stew.) Yook geh jang, (spicy, shredded beef soup with japchae noodles.) I'll ask for extra spicy for that soup but its got pretty good heat as is. Everything that is spicy....u can get it milder or stronger.  The Ojing ah bokkem.(spicy squid with vegetables stir fry.) The bbq is good but I really believe the soups, stews and seafoods are the things that make me crave for the things that taste like home. 
I've learned that its easier and less, ( price wise,) to do lunch or lunch takeout. I've tried many other korean places in SF and this is by far the best. Especially if you like a lot of variety with banchans. 
If you're looking to take a party with more than 5 people. The set menu for dinner is the best bang for your buck.  That's probably the only times where I'll dine in-house. Other than that, 20 mins. for takeout. No hunting for parking. Everything included with your order, (except the egg dish.) Easy Peasy and your clothes won't smell like smoky bbq.
author: gina s.

description: Awesome Korean place in the Richmond district of SF. Definitely in my top 10 of SF and maybe all. Love this place, great food and menu selection. They have all the typical Korean BBQ items to BBQ at your table and no limits on the Galbi (short ribs) like other places. Love the kimchi pancakes and all the many banchan (side appetizers). This place is popular and quite busy and usually a line and wait, but well worth it.
author: Peter K.

description:
3 stars for the food.  Round up from 3.5 stars for the good banchan and free extras.

Just biked through Golden Gate Park and needed a lunch spot to recharge the batteries.  My gf and her sis were in the mood for Korean so we tried here...

If you are picky when it comes to entrees, then perhaps you should pass here.  Our bbq chicken was dry and bland.  The kalbi was also dry and not marinated well...  Mere sustenance as we were starving following our bike ride...

Service is what you can expect from an Asian restaurant--not much interaction between you and the staff.

While the food was average, I am giving a half star for the free extras they provided and also for their good banchan (side dishes).

Round up and arrive at a 4 star review.  An underwhelming 4 star establishment, it is....
author: Mark H.

description: Great food. Customer service was okay but who cares. The food are amazing. We got there around 6ish and there was already a long line ahead of us. Make sure you call to make reservation ahead of time
author: A V.

description: I came in to Han Il Kwan by myself to have a solo meal. I put my name down on the list, table for 1. It was early so there were some open tables, but the host showed some mild concerns about which table I would sit at. No problem, I understand they have capacity issues. I offered to get takeout instead. I think it was appreciated, but I was quickly forgotten. 40 minutes later I asked about my food - guess it was just sitting on the counter for a while getting cold. I get that their tour bus customers are their priority, but the whole situation rubbed me the wrong way.
author: Kate T.

description:
Simply put, Han Il Kwan provides authentic and very good Korean food. Although the service is lacking due to the limited English, the foods of this place makes up for that. This place was packed Saturday evening but mainly because we saw 2 Asian tour busses dropping off tourists at this restaurant 2 times in a row while we were eating. These tourists made up the majority of the place. Once they left, the place became half empty but the workers scrambled to setup the tables for the next tour bus. Interesting.

We ordered way too much food for 3 people: short ribs, spicy pork, beef vermicelli noodles, and seafood tofu soup. In addition, they provided tons of appetizers along with a fluffy egg thing in a pot. 3 people came out to $93! Each plate of meat (order at least 2 and you can bbq it on the table) was about $30. Very pricey but the quality of the meat was good. The spicy pork was flavorful and delicious. A plate comes with enough pork to feed a few people. The kim chi and spicy salted anchovies were my favorite appetizers; it was spiced and it tasted just right. 

Overall, although our meal was expensive, we would've been fine if we ordered one less dish. I would recommend this place if you're in the area, but if you're located quite a far drive from this place, there are other great Korean spots that provides the same quality foods at different parts of the Bay.
author: Rita K.

description:
One of my absolute favorite go-to Korean restaurant. Went here 2 years ago, but never got the chance to try again until now!

Being Asian, and being a college kid, PRICE, PRICE, PRICE matters! My friends and I headed to the restaurant at 3:30pm on a Tuesday afternoon and we did the craziest FAST AND FURIOUS drive to pick up 2 other people and try to make it for their lunch special ending at 4pm. ***ALL DRIVING WAS LEGAL, (somewhat safe-ish, but still legal) DONT REPORT US*** We were so desperate, every minute made us sweat. We weren't about to pay full price for the dishes! haha. We literally got there at 3:57 and PRAYED TO BUDDAH that we could still do the lunch special. The waitress said yes, but we had to do it quick. So we all took a minute to choose a different thing to share. We quickly ordered and WHEW.... we BARELY made it in time. 

Grubs: 
-Marinated Beef Ribs
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/han-il-kwan-san-francisco?select=gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag#EdaTtp5txOEMVCgHCZVjBg
-Marinated Rib Eye
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/han-il-kwan-san-francisco?select=gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag#Cpqg8YXjECGow_xtlR63jA
-Spicy Pork 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/han-il-kwan-san-francisco?select=gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag#hwivG2AJLjoZwRtntZDWhw
-BBQ Chicken 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/han-il-kwan-san-francisco?select=gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag#gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag
-Assorted Pan-fried, Oyster, Fish, Vegetable Dipped In Batter
(sorry no picture, i didnt get to try!)

GOODIES (no.. not drugs...-__-):
-FREE DELICIOUS TOFU SOUP! A complimentary of the lunch special 
-Complimentary variety of side dishes (the fish cake is absolutely addicting)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/han-il-kwan-san-francisco?select=gZXr-TIgno-a08tjco3Rag#wcHF419dHXVsI4dVjm9XZw
-Complimentary dessert after your meal (Sikhye, rice drink) It looked shady, but trust me, its GOOD. It's sweet and smooth. 
-ALL meats were cooked perfectly and seasoned well! 
-accepts credit cards
-parking is easy! (look around the neighboring streets!)
-Lunch special is best deal 11am-4pm (the price is SOOOO worth it!)

why I didnt give it 5stars:
-one of the waitress was pretty rude. If I was basing this on the service, I would give it 2 stars. She would always glare at us and look down on us when we asked her for anything. I asked if she can get us all water and she only gave us one. And she rudely dumped it on the table and walked away. Not cool. They are SO lucky their food and deal are so good to save her disrespect.
author: Chena N.

description:
Took the family here Saturday.  I'll start with the food.  We had the Tofu soup which was good but not great, two types of beef including the Galbi which was excellent, and a hot stone pot with beef and egg which wasn't bad.  I would give the food overall 4 stars and think it is one of the better places in bay area to grab Korean food (not saying much since the bay area isn't nearly as good with Korean food as Southern California).  

Now we get to the bad part.  The waitress we had was downright mean.  We asked for recommendations and she acted like she was giving up her left lung to help us.   Not only was she mean, she gave off a vibe of just not wanting to be bothered by anything.   The fact that this restaurant gets 4 stars despite the horrible way it treats its customers shows how good the food can be.  

I won't say I wouldn't come back for lunch for the food if I'm in the area and bring my headphones to block out the bad service but Han II Kwan isn't a place I would just drive to on its own for a pleasurable dining experience
author: Steven S.

description: Love the beef galbi, always make a stop for it. Lunch for $15 and dinner for $30 for some quality galbi, can't be beat. Sometimes the wait is long but definitely worth the wait.
author: Iaintworried B.

description:
I have been coming here for over a decade and they never disappoint. Made a reservation for 5 people 2 hours before dinner time. You can either cook your food or have the kitchen cook it for you. If you're cooking on your own at the table, wear old dirty clothes because after you come out of the restaurant, you'll reek of food. Not something I prefer. 

The bad part of coming here is the parking. I had to circle around for 10 minutes and thankfully the white zone outside became available and perfect timing (after 8pm). We ordered the braised ox tail, kalbi, spicy pork, jap chae, and squid. Soup, rice, and ban chan (little dishes) were on the house and can be refilled if requested. The lady who helped us was super nice (thanks!). She refilled our ban chans many times and with a smile. Typically the older ladies are not the friendliest and super stingy with refills. This place is legit and I can always count on good food.
author: W W.

description: The food was good but we waited an hour for a table. We counted 5 tour buses coming in and out filling up the entire restaurant. It felt like a huge joke was being played on us.
author: Jazmin S.

description: Wonderful meals and incredible service! I decided to try spicy bulgogi and yes it was delicious. Regrettably though, tofu soup was common. My visit here was interesting. I will certainly visit again.
author: Patricia B.

description:
Interior: open and clean. 
Food: we all got bim bim bap but without the clay pot... they didn't do a great job of explaining that the food would be cold (they said room temp but it wasn't clear) if not in a clay pot. Next time we will get it in a clay pot. The banchan was plentiful and they even gave us free tea, tofu soup and a small dessert drink!!!! Next time I want to try the bbq that they cook in front of you.
Price: as expected for a Korean place in SF. Bim bim bap was most reasonable at $11, the rest ranged from $15-20. Makes sense though with all the free side dishes!
Service: okay, nice enough but nothing special.

Will come again.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Best Korean restaurant in the city. Doesn't take reservations and the wait can get long, so beat the rush! Large serving sizes of delicious Korean food. I'm a fan of the Kimchi jun (so thick here!!).
author: Annie S.

description:
I love this place. Have not had better Korean food anywhere. The tofu soup (comes with every meal) is good for what ails you. The tofu is SO fresh and the texture is amazing. Great service, great lunch deals. This place is super-legit. Jab che is delightfully greasy, so yummy. 

Came here for lunch with two friends, ate a good amount of garlicy awesomeness, and had enough food left for at least one more meal. All for $42. 

Great place to stop before or after a museum trip, within walking distance to the De Young and California Academy of science
author: Cheryl H.

description:
Great place for Korean food in the city. I'm still a big fan of all you can eat korean BBQ especially korean bbq in So-cal and although this place doesn't offer it, their korean food is very good for the price you have to pay. 

We ordered:

Kalbi: tasty marinated beef short rib. Meat is tender and you can either get it cooked by the kitchen or grill yourself at the table.

Pork belly: pretty much pork belly with no added flavoring grilled and we also ordered this precooked instead of grilling ourselves at the table

#25 long boiled beef short ribs with potatoes and carrots: this takes awhile to cook but comes out in a claypot style hot and ready to eat. Beef short ribs are amazingly good with soft potatoes and carrots to go with. Make sure you have the server cut the meat out of the bone to make it easy to eat. 

Seafood pancake: crispy fried seafood pancake that comes with a great vinegar soy sauce for dipping. 

chop chae: sauteed clear noodles with beef and veggies. Great noodle dish to go with all the meat. 

Great place for groups

Tip: Always make a reservation. Sometimes on week nights they can have tours that bring in a lot of customers for them and the restaurant can get packed!
author: Joanne K.

description:
3.5 stars. Honestly, I would have given this place 4 stars but when I factored in the service and the cleanliness, I felt I had to take off a star. I've been to this restaurant maybe twice before and I was always impressed with the food. But it's not just the food that I'm writing this review for. It's the overall quality of the restaurant.

When we walked into the restaurant, there was a sign near the door that says for us to wait to be seated. We waited for about a minute before someone noticed us and seated us with menus. I love the menu. There were tons of colored photos so that we can see what we are ordering. My sister, my cousin, and I decided to order three items: the beef short ribs ($11.95), spicy pork ($8.50), and kimchi pancakes ($14.95).   

We waited, and waited, and waited for awhile before the server returned to take our orders. Maybe we were a little cranky because we were hungry (again). But it felt like it took forever before they noticed that we were ready to order. When the server brought us our utensils, I noticed that my spoon had rice dried onto the back of it. There was also a wasp that flew around our table, which scared us half to death since we didn't want to be stung. And there was a fruit fly hovering over our food once our food arrived. 

The food itself was wonderful. I have never seen so many side dishes offered before. They even offered a complimentary tofu soup! Side dishes included seasoned bean sprouts, kimchi, fish cake, spicy yellow radishes (the ones found in sushi rolls), spicy white radish, some sort of white jello thing in spicy soy sauce, and spicy cucumbers. All were delicious and very filling. I think those dishes in itself could have been a meal.

I didn't try the beef short ribs since I don't eat beef. But the spicy pork was delicious. It was the right level of spiciness and the meat was tender and flavorful. The kimchi pancakes were pretty good too. I loved the pancake batter because it was crispy on the edges. I'm on the edge about the kimchi inside the pancakes. Only because every once in awhile I feel like it was too sour. But over all, I thought they were pretty good.

I also loved that as dessert, they gave us a complimentary rice drink with our bill. It was sweet and there were some soft rice at the bottom.

In the end, I was a little annoyed that they took awhile to give us our bill too. The servers came in and out a lot and by then, there weren't that many tables left so I couldn't understand why they didn't see us waving at them. In general, I felt that the service was slow even though there weren't too many customers.

I really liked this place from my previous visits so I'm just going to assume that it was an off day for them. But I hope that in the future, the service isn't going to be as slow as it was today.
author: Andrea G.

description: Very fast customer service, and the meat is amazing. A bit pricey but the amount of food you get makes up for it
author: Fernando V.

description: One of better authentic tasting Korean BBQ restaurant to visit when I at SF.  Enjoyed the typical Korean dishes, meats and soups.  The only CON is parking, if you happened to be driving.
author: Sam P.

description: Had a great time overeating our Korean bbq hearts content.  They had the set menu for 6 which we added more food bc we were 7 but totally shouldn't have.  The set menu was more than enough.  By the end of our meals the cool boss servers taught us the Korean word for cheers, 'geon bae', and how to get the most of our soju & beer.  During the meal, food just kept coming and the service was well attended (they cook and cut the kalbi) and were very nice to us.  My friend was so happy he wondered if south Korea was just as cool and how the time spent felt like being in Basque.
author: Sandra W.

description:
Got to the restaurant before 5pm and there were plenty of tables to sit at but the woman with the chubby round face said we have to wait because there wasn't enough tables. 3 empty booths is not enough tables open? 

So we asked someone that we've seen working there since we've been going there for the last 20 plus years. She told us there were plenty of tables and got the owner/manager in charge to seat us. The first woman was horrible. I understand you have a tour bus to cater but we deserve to be treated as well.

Food as usual was good. Service was okay considering some rude waitresses. 

Paid for the bill waited for everyone to be ready to leave and the same round fat faced woman comes around our table glaring at us like why we haven't left yet. We just paid we don't have to leave till we're completely done.
author: Avery K.

description:
I find San Francisco to be somewhat lacking in great Korean BBQ. It's one of those things - like extra warm weather or more places to buy yoga pants and froyo - that people who love Los Angeles always tout as a benefit over living in San Francisco.

Han II Kwan is about the best I think you can do in the city. Generous with the little dishes they serve at the beginning, and a good selection of well apportioned entrees.

My tips for you:

-Don't order the "recommended" family style menu. You can do better (economically) and also selection-wise ordering for yourself

-Cook your own food tables are extremely limited. If you want that you could be waiting a lot of extra time

-This place is a whole lot bigger than it looks from the outside. Even though there appeared to be a tour bus referenced in other reviews the last time we visited, there seem to be at least 3 separate dining areas and during my time there, I saw no evidence of a giant group.
author: Stephanie T.

description: It's a lovely experience and the food is quite good.  It was my first time eating Korean, but according to my friends this place is quite authentic.  They bring a wide range of dishes and sauces and pickled bites to go along with the meat.  It was fun to explore all of the tastes.  Apparently it can get very busy if there is a tour bus and on Friday's, but there was not wait when we were there.
author: Greta R.

description:
Good:
- The food is amazing, and they have every style of korean food. They have home style korean food and KBBQ.
- The service is pretty good. The waitresses are very kind and attentive. They are always taking out empty plates so you can have more space for the next coming dish. 
- The best part of Han Il Kwan is their banchan. So varied and everything is really tasty.

Not so good:
- Parking is sort of difficult to find around the area specially if you go there at night.

What I recommend:
- Get their Bulgogi in a plate, is as good as cooking it yourself in the grill and you don't get to have the smell staying in your clothes.
author: H C.

description: I was expecting the food to be much better than what it was. Oxtail soup was bland and the meat wasn't anything special. I've had much better in LA. Banchi dishes were pretty good, not stellar. But service was horrible. I waited for 45 minutes for my order, then had to go to the cashier's desk to ask about my dish. At the end of the meal, I flagged a server down and she totally ignored me, proceeded to set a large table, and then later brought my check without a word. I don't understand why this place gets rated so highly except that perhaps it's because of the low overall quality of Korean food in SF.
author: elaine l.

description:
Dang. This place is legit. My first visit here was with a couple of friends who wanted Korean BBQ. We ended up ordering way too much but don't regret it at all. Though, I wish we chose the self-serve type of BBQ. Not as fun if you just have your meat already cooked on a hot teriyaki pan! 

Today I tried out their cold noodles in chicken broth. SPOT ON. The noodles were chewy, broth was flavorful, side dishes were plentiful. I thought at one point they would skim on the side dishes because I was by myself, but no. If I remember correctly, I was served 8 side dishes and most of them were pretty delicious. I expected better kimchi and sweet syrupy potatoes though. To round it out, they served me a side of steamed eggs on the house. Nicely done! 

This place would come first on my mind if I ever wanted Korean BBQ with a group of friends.
author: Jackie C.

description: I have finally found a Korean restaurant that is almost as good as the one I had in South Bay.  This place has pretty good small dishes although it doesn't have nori like the place I had in South Bay.  The lunch price is reasonable, but dinner is pretty pricy.  Service is a hit or miss (mostly miss..) and line is pretty long for lunch.  This is my go to place for Korean food fix in the city.
author: Joyce T.

description:
This was a great experience and I can validate everything being said in regard to the Bi Bim Bap...it was very tasty, especially when adding in the house hot sauce. The meals are huge portions and come with standard appetizers, soup, and tea. 

Also the notes about this being a drop off zone for weary-eyed Korean tourists is 100% true. At precisely 7:15PM two large tour buses pull up out front and 50 people come streaming in turning the quiet Richmond Dist restaurant into a lively night out. at precisely 7:45pm they were all done and buses had left. 

It was almost comical and i am not sure if I liked this or not. Pros: Koreans coming from Korea to eat this Korean food...that's a good sign; Cons: is this a tourist spot now a la Fisherman's Warf where you cant find a good meal to save your life???....hmmm im still on the fence but objectively I thought the food was good and at a very non SF price.
author: Derek S.

description: Decently sized portions along with the quality of the food. Our waitress confused all of our dishes for another table and there was a hilarious stare off from the table next to us as they were thinking we were going to eat their food. This was surely entertaining but the staff should really know where the food goes..
author: Bernard W.

description: Went in today for lunch at around noon and there were plenty of tables available. They have a lunch menu that's available until 4:30 PM, Mon-Fri. I ordered the short ribs and they were delicious and tender. The meal includes banchan and tofu soup for the table, as well as the entree ordered. Everything was delicious. I have been here quite a few times and will continue to come back. Food and service was excellent. The sweet rice water drink they give is the perfect way to end the meal.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Terrible Service, average food.

Food: We ordered ox tail, bibimbab and tofu soup. The ox tail is fragrant and delicious, but the other dishes are tasteless and bland. 

Services: we waited 30 mins for just the sides, and one hour for the tofu soup. Last but not the least, 1.5 hour for the egg pudding (one of the appetizers.) Politeness waitress, and they let the Korean to get the table first. They were kind and quick in serving Korean, yet I am not the one.
author: Terence W.

description: Best Korean restaurant in the city. Great kimchi jjigae, and tak toritang and pajun. They also give you a lot of side dishes and service is pretty good too. My fob Korean friends loved it and ate here 3x during their week trip (which is pretty lame of them). I will definitely come here again when I am craving non-fusion, authentic kfood!
author: Juliana P.

description: Would have given 5 stats, but the customer service is horrible. The food, however, is so good! Big portions and very well balanced - not cloying sweet like other Korean places. Sometimes the wait can be long, but it's worth it. Favorite dishes are the short ribs and kalbi jim.
author: Robbie R.

description:
Food was ok, not great. BBQ was cooked in kitchen and served to us, which was disappointing but not unusual. However, most of the meats were over cooked and low quality or freshness. Pork belly was basically not edible. The tofu in the sundubu wasn't very soft. The sundubu itself was forgettable. Bibimap was bland. Asked for gochujjang and never got it. 

Yes, there was a tour bus outside, but I take that more as a sign of homesick desperation by Korean tourists than a sign of quality. 

This is my first Korean in SF. I hope this isn't the best SF has got...
author: Yoeun P.

description:
I've been here hundreds of times before and nothing's ever changed. The only thing that's diminished is the service. Before, the waiters will always greet you, young or old. Then, they'd tell you to wait or lead you to your seat. Now, they EXPECT you to know that you have to write down your name, and wait. That's it!
Still, hands the BEST Korean / Korean BBQ place in San Francisco!
author: PokeMoshimon Y.

description:
The best part of eating here is all the banchan they offer, along with the option of the tofu stew (soon doo boo) or steamed egg. Seriously a great addition to whatever you decide to order! 

Went here with 2 friends, and we ordered the pork bulgogi and seafood pancake (pajun). The servings were huge and were PLENTY for the 3 of us, including leftovers. The pork bulgogi was a very large portion and you could easily split with with four people. It was really good as well. The seafood pancake was a little too thick for my liking - I generally like my pajun to be thinner and crispier on the outside. Less doughy, perhaps? But if you like this type of pajun, the serving is also very large. Not very much seafood though. 

We got the tofu stew with the banchan which was a really great addition to the meal, and the service was really good. They ask if you need any of the banchan replaced and you don't feel like you're bothering them with the request! 

All in all, a great Korean spot that won't cost you too much and has a lot of variety for you to choose from.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Being Korean American and native to San Francisco, this is my favorite Korean restaurant in San Francisco. You can't get this Authentic, since it is hard to find a Korean restaurant around here that is very Authentic to our culture. We all know how Korean food can be a bit pricey, but I'm surprise how reasonable the price is here for a Korean restaurant. Especially their Galbi Jiim (Korean short rib stew) is close as to my mom's homemade cooking
author: Eron C.

description:
Okay, the wait here at 6:00PM was AWFUL even though calling 30 minutes earlier they said there was no wait. This place fills up quick. Also, although there's a ton of street parking it was all COMPLETELY full. We had to drive around for 15+ minutes trying to find a spot. You've been warned.

Hungry, a little tired, and starving despite being three peppermints in, we finally got seated. The ban chan was not bad--standard fish rectangles (there's got to be a better name for that), bean sprouts, pickled radish, kim chee, and potatoes (!!!!!) and more, we placed our orders.

I got the sundubu, which was just perfect. Soft tofu with some vegetables, it was super filling especially with the side of rice it came with. I wished there was a little meat in it, but they advertised it as "beef broth" so I can't say I was misled.
author: Rosy H.

description: Ate here with a few friends and for 50 bucks it was a decent price for 3 people. We got 2 servings of Samgyeopsal (pork belly), and a ton of side dishes. Plus with the rice and the lettuce to make wraps, we left happy and full. The food was good quality and the service was nice. I would gladly comeback here again, plus it wasn't that packed so I like the quiet and quaint atmosphere. I love the sweet rice drink they brought us after the meal it was refreshing. It's kinda hidden though, but that was makes it all the more appealing.
author: Pia A.

description:
Food is okay. My bibimbap lacked meat. Seriously they only had like 5 tiny wrinkly pieces of meat and the whole bowl was filled with rice.

We got seated at the corner seat, never got any attention, even when I flapped my arms around like a crazy woman everytime we wanted to order, have refills, or checks. Thats 3x! Had to stand up and catch their attention, and even then they may be busy. Sigh :(

One of the perks here is just the free tofu soup and cheaper price at lunch.

I dont think I'll be coming back unless I really need korean food. And I'm not ordering that bibimbap anymore.
author: Inez J.

description:
Food rating: 4.5/5
as authentic Korean food as it could get. And best of all, any Korean food that you are craving, it is on the menu. Everyone gets their favourite dish. 

Wait time: almost 2hr!!!
Came here during dinner hour at 7, and was only seated at 9pm. You would be amazed that everyone here waited despite that.

Service: 5/5
They refilled the pan chan promptly,
Asked how was the food, which is very rare for such a busy asian eateries. ( and okay, we kinda got bribed with a free tofu hotplate )
And there is this free sweet rice drink to cleanse the palate after food. 

P.S. Finding a nearby street Parking spot in this area is terrible.
author: alea x.

description: The food was decent but I feel it was overpriced. I think the experience would have been better if the servers didn't come over and constantly cook our food for us. It felt as if we were being pushed out of the restaurant which completely destroyed the experience. I probably won't give this establishment another chance. However, I was able to enjoy the banchan and I think it was tasty.
author: Courtney A.

description:
Finally, a legitimate Korean BBQ place in SF proper. No wonder they bus in Korean tourists to eat here--it tastes just like the motherland. I'm so stoked to have found Han Il Kwan, no longer do I need to fly down to SoCal, NoVa, or Sunnyvale to eat an authentic Korean food. 

We've tried Galbi, Seafood Casserole, Mul Naengmyun, and everything tastes on the same par as the really good places in SoCal, NoVa and Flushing. Well, except for the Naengmyun, maybe this was an off day for Naengmyun.

The panchans were great but the steamed egg souffle (on the house) was a bit bland but I'm a fan of the generous portion of the ShikHae after our meal. The price is reasonable, service is adequate but it's always a full house at dinner time here so at least we were served and refilled with everything requested. Yey!
author: Taffany H.

description: A great korean BBQ place. The prices are reasonable and the banchan is great. They keep refilling it which is always a plus too. Loved the seafood kimchi pancake. It's actually one of my favorite pancakes. You know this place is legit because all the korean tour buses arrive daily before 7pm. There will be a wait for food, but it's worth it!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Came here for the first time with some friends on a Saturday night and oh boy, the waiting was crazy. I guess that should be expected since it's a Saturday? 

Anyway, after over an hour wait, we finally got our round table. (We were a party of 5). We almost left the place if not because of the time we spent looking for parking. We spent a good amount of time looking and didn't want it to go to waste.  

They have a menu for a large group, which was perfect for us. We ordered Dinner A for a party of six for $140. We got to choose two kinds of meat, and it comes with tofu soup, squid with veggies, bibimbap, broiled fish, stir fried vermicelli, pan fried shrimps and veggies, steamed eggs. Yup definitely had a lot of left overs.

Honestly, I think the food was okay but kinda pricey. I really like the rice juice they gave out at the end though. It was sweet and refreshing. I recommend to try it. I would prob go back here if I'm around the area only... because really, parking is hard to find.

The customer service was not that great so just be prepared. We were only given three servings of rice and when I asked for the other two, the lady came back with one rice. So I asked her later again and she seemed irritated. She answered "I gave you one already!" 

Well duh? I know that, but I asked for two! I needed one more that's why I asked her. It didn't occur to her I guess? Maybe didn't hear my "two". She didn't seem too happy and since they were busy I felt like I was bothering her. I understand that they were busy and I didn't really care about that missing rice.  I just didn't like they way she had to raise her voice at me. I was only asking for a rice and she yelled at me in front of my friends.=/ Anyway, she didn't come back with the other one. Totally ignored me.
author: Isabella D.

description:
Amazing grill. The seasoned beef ribs was amazing. The little appetisers were really yummy, as good as the top Korean restaurants I've tried in Singapore (I've not been to Korea before so I can't judge for its authenticity.) There's even free refill as it should be :)

The bibimbap was great. I also liked the hot pot stew as well. The ox tail was soft and tender, braised to perfection. It was certainly worth the wait.

Service can be slightly brash at times as the restaurant looks slightly understaffed.

The complimentary sweet drink at the end made from fermented rice is the icing on the cake.

Service can be a little slow but friendly as it looks slightly understaffed. I watched as waitresses rush from table to table to serve food as soon as ther are out.
author: Han Teng W.

description: Stopped by after a round at Harding Park with a few buddies. Place was packed, had a tour bus up front and the waiting list was deep. Hung out for about 30 mins and we got a table. Food was really good, meat quality was great, lots of ban chan and the best part was it didn't break the bank. Definitely putting this place on my regular list.
author: Jay P.

description: Would you just look at that banchan spread?! Every side dish was excellent and colorful. Very generous. Outstanding authentic Korean spot for sure and I can't wait to go back with a bigger party to try more dishes. Actually went solo this time for lunch and got the classic tofu stew which was really tasty. They comped me the egg soufflé and there were so many banchan side dishes that I'm entirely too full right now. Next time I'll try to grilled some meats and one of the the spicy stews. (Haven't had one of those since I was in Korea.) Really looking forward to learning more about this spot. Another Richmond Balboa gem!
author: Brian J.

description: I love this place. I use to come here occasionally for dinner and I recently discovered their lunch special. You get so much for your money! This has become my favorite lunch spot. I do wish the Kalbi was marinated with a little bit more soy sauce and sugar. It isn't as flavorful but i know it's hard to please everyone.
author: Karen L.

description:
Came here with my sister for a late lunch. We were seated immediately, but felt like the service could have been much better. We didn't get the attention we needed when it came to refilling our water or trying to get our order taken. The servers seem to be in the kitchen or standing behind the bar area the whole time rather than checking if things are good for their customers - which is a pity because I did really enjoy their food so I docked off a point. 

Other than that, the food was good! We had the lunch specials: bugolgi and kalbi which came with rice and a tofu soup for our table. We had a bunch of complimentary side dishes as well, in which nothing in it wow'ed me, but we did get a complimentary pancake thing as an appetizer and the dipping sauce for it was delicious. For $25 lunch was worth it for us :) Will possibly come back for the food, but the service could definitely be much better.
author: Amanda C.

description: They give plenty of yummy banchan (side dishes that come with the meals). There's usually a wait and the service is okay, but love the food.
author: Erika T.

description:
1) You can know how good a Korean restaurant is by tasting their appetizers. 

2) I cannot have enough of Han II kwan's appetizer.
author: Alex C.

description:
Their lunch specials are just awesome. Great food and good price. The dinner is still the same great food for double the price.

I almost always order the ribs and highly recommend it. 

Just wish the service was quicker.
author: Ken T.

description: Terrible experience. There were 6 families waiting to be seated but the waitress refused to seat any of us even though there were plenty of open tables. We didn't complain because the staff looked really busy. But then we waited 40 minutes and got the only table that didn't have side dishes pre-set.
author: Jazmin P.

description: I usually don't like Korean food and wasn't thrilled when my friend made me come here for dinner. Boy was I wrong! This place is delicious! The beef is on point! We also had some type of noodles with veggies and tofu soup and everything was great!
author: Lena T.

description: Best bimbibap I've had and the side dishes were amazing! The rice punch after the meal was a nice touch! Definitely will be coming back.
author: Thanyawan A.

description:
Admittedly, I haven't sampled many Korean restaurants in SF, but this one is definitely my favorite so far. They have lots and lots of different side dishes (banchan), which I love. The service is also not too bad for non-Korean speakers, especially compared to some experiences I've had in LA. I've always gotten refills on side dishes when I wanted them. Plus, they always give a freebie like tofu soup or steamed eggs. One time we even got pan-fried mung bean pancakes. I've always gotten the sweet rice drink (sikye) as a dessert as well. 

I usually order the stone pot bibimbap or the seafood pancake when I come here, both of which are pretty good. I've also tried their yukgejang (spicy beef stew), which seemed fine to me, although I don't have much experience with that dish. I still have yet to try their BBQ.

Parking can be difficult around here, but there are several Muni lines that run nearby.
author: Alex Y.

description: Best Korean BBQ I've ever had ! I can't wait to have it again. Definitely worth the wait for a BBQ table! It's soooo good and FRESH!
author: Taylor C.

description:
So far, my favorite Korean barbecue in SF, and the only one that matches my memories of Koreatown in New York -- though unlike those, this one is more of a daytime, orderly, family-friendly sit down meal than the late night clubbing experience that goes on in New York.

It's all about the food. We had soft tofu soup, seafood dolsat bibimbap, and sautéed squid. The tofu soup was rich, flavorful, and just right. The bibimbap was perfect too, perfectly crisped rice on the outside, flavorful inside, good balance, a fresh and generous assortment of seafood (both somewhat unusual among SF Korean restaurants) though understandably using lots of smaller shrimp and scallops instead of centerpieces. My favorite was the squid, large slices of big squids, vegetables, perfectly toothy yet tender. All of these dishes had a nice balance of flavor that was both fresh and clear, but also multilayered and full of umami, thanks I think to a chili sauce (that also came in a squirt bottle on the table) that had a miso-like taste in addition to its heat and chili flavor. They also brought out a steamed egg custard on the house (delicious, delicate), and the customary sweet rice dessert in the little plastic cups (nice). The banchan was a standout, unusually bright tasting and fresh despite many items being fermented. The real test, the kimche, was some of the best in town, but even the minimally processed cucumber slices were just right.

Prices were about average. If you barbecue at the table be ready to pay $23+ per person, plus drinks, tax, tip, and any side orders so it adds up. If you order the regular items on the menu, it's a deal -- we got twice as much food as two people could reasonably eat for lunch for about $45 plus tip, and like most garlic and chili bombs this food gets better after a day in the fridge.

Service was moderately attentive and prompt, formal if a little gruff and curt at first, but grew warmer and outright kind after we told them how much we were enjoying the food. So I think the waitstaff and food runners take pride in their business. 

Decor was fairly basic but nice, and pretty clean for a moderately priced Asian restaurant in the Richmond District -- it's made to look like the courtyard of an old style Korean village with tile roofs, dark and atmospheric even in the foggy lunchtime daylight.

I'm definitely going back, this is a new go-to spot, this and My Tofu House. The main drawback, unfortunately, is parking. This is a very, very hard neighborhood to find a parking space anytime of the week. The mini business district is mostly surrounded by unmetered residential streets, so the local residents leave their vehicles in the same place for hours and days at a time. It's not near a major public transportation line. So just use your parking karma, or be prepared to park a few blocks away and walk. Or take a Lyft.
author: Gil S.

description:
Meats- 
Galbi- one of the best quality in SF
Bulgogi- decent
Chicken- decent

Beer- very cheap and big, the korean way

Staff-
They are super busy, but were still accommodating, especially for our large group size. We didn't have a reservation and were fortunate to get seated after waiting only ~10 minutes. 
Service was great!
author: Ziran X.

description: Long wait on weekends but their service is really attentive and nice! I recommend getting a bibimbap and some different selection of meats! Best side dishes!
author: Sarah H.

description: Great Korean food, so tasty and spicey.  Come hungry, the food is delicious, usually get a barbecue and Bi Bim Bap, all the condiments, a lot of food for two.  Fun atmosphere, always busy, good service.  Love that this gem is in my neighborhood, always a fun spot to take foodie friends.
author: Carole W.

description:
Ordered the menu for 6 and it could've fed 8. Tons of food. Everything was very good and came out quickly. Maybe too quickly. It felt like an eating contest but I'm good with that. 

Favorite dishes were the bulgogi and noodles. Good service, the server gave us some fun soju recommendations. Very fun for a group of friends dining family style.
author: Tina W.

description:
I gave it 5 stars because it's fantastic and great value and exactly what you're looking for. I was worried because it was basically full when we arrived at 6:15 but there was no real line ahead of us. He told the people after us 20 minutes so I estimated 15-18 for us but we were seated in 10.

We ordered spicy beef soup, beef short rib hot pot, and some fried fish. The soup was enough for about 6 portions so we ate a bit and saved room. Before the next courses were served they put literally 10 kinds of kimchi and other pickled veggies on the table. Then the hot pot arrived and it was in a word, amazing. THe beef was super duper tender, fall off the bone, yet incredibly tasty. The carrots and potatoes compliment it perfectly and the sauce/gravy was fabulous. The fish were fried perfectly and flakey goodness.

We brought a lot of it home since it was enough food for 3-4 people and we were only 2. $60 + tax and tip. Will return. We missed a serious rush by 6:30 on a Sunday it was slammed and a serious line.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Personally, I think the food here is good and the cost is reasonable. They give out large amount of food!! Every time when I leave this place, I am so full that I don't think about food anymore...but after a while, when I am hungry again, I think about the food I ate earlier. It's that good!! 
I just tried rice cake soup and the seafood stone rice today, they are both surprisingly good! Usually I would just order spicy rice cake and pancake and a dish of meat or soup. Since the menus is kind of limited, it's good to know that the things I don't find appealing actually taste way better than I thought!!
I find the service here is decent. The waitresses are so friendly and smiley, they are also really patient! 
It's a great place to eat!
author: Yuy H.

description:
"Why is there a huge tour bus out front?"
"Oh, it's completely booked? Not even the regular long wait? Ok"

Han Il Kwan is often packed with customers and sometimes even completely full due to it being a stop for tour buses. With that said, it is popular, but the food is rather lacking. 

On multiple occasions the bulgogi (marinated sliced beef) along with other meat dishes, such as Galbi(spareribs) and pork are dry. The marinade is fine, but the meat should be cooked less as the hot plate they are served on will continue to cook it. 
Among the less memorable food items was a seafood soup. The broth was decent, but not spectacular. 

The best dish I found here was the dolsot bibimbap. Every component from the vegetables to the meat seemed to be cooked well and I really enjoy the crunchy rice in the bowl. 

Overall, you can definitely find better Korean food in the South Bay, especially for the price.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Food was hit n miss
Kalbi - marinated short ribs were ok
Spicy bulgogi - so much better than the kalbi and more flavorful
Soft tofu soup - not spicy at all so I added the kimchee from the ban chan 
Steamed egg - soufflé texture pretty cool and tasty when added to the tofu soup + kimchee
Service sucked... another couple who were 10min ahead of us were still waiting, we were also waiting for 30+ min. The guy with a mustache gave away a table to 2 chicks who just walked in and batted their eyes. On top of that the guy with the mustache was pretty sarcastic and deliberately rude. Glad to have tried this place, but there are far better places for the exact same price, amount of food, but better service.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
hands down, my favorite korean restaurant in the city! why you ask?

1. you know it's legit when there's a designated tour bus parking spot right outside the restaurant (it's normally the korean tour bus that parks there haha)
2. they give you so many side dishes! they give you at least 9, but on their good days, they'll give you more!
3. free tofu soup and onion pancakes
4. their food is just amazing. i'm a huge fan of their hot stone bibimbap. i have a really low tolerance with spicy food so i always have to order mild. usually, people add this spicy sauce to their bibimbap, but i don't like it. and almost every bibimbap i've eaten tastes dry without the spicy sauce. but this place adds enough flavoring in their seafood bibimbap so it doesn't taste dry at all.
5. i think the food here is worth your money, even if it's a bit on the pricey side, but at you get lots of free side dishes, tofu soup, and onion pancakes! :D
6. the service is good too. they're pretty attentive to their customers' needs.
7. the rice dessert drink is good too (they give it to you after you're done with your meal)

notes: parking here can be very difficult. they have bbq tables o regular tables. you're gonna smell like food in your hair and clothes. the bulgogi meat might be dry/doesn't have enough flavoring so i probably wouldn't recommend ordering that. order the seafood bibimbap if you love seafood and bibimbap! you won't regret it! it's usually really busy around dinner time.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Alright, I definitely love this place. Not only do they have lunch specials, but their food is legit and delicious. Prices are really decent, and portions are large. Favs? Dolsot bibimbap. Hot, soft (and crunchy) rice, a fried egg, lots of veggies, and tender beef. What's not to like? Tofu soup comes out piping hot, soft, and in large quantities. And the banchan game. Sooo good. 8 dishes - anchovies, fish cake, turnips, radishes, etc. Service is really attentive, but be prepared to wait for dinner. Lunch time is a great time to come here because of the specials and because you'll probably be able to grab a seat or four.
author: Danny C.

description:
So delicious - I'm already looking forward to going back!

We had the:
- Seafood pancake
- Stone pot bibimbap
- Spicy beef soup

The meal also came with at least 11 side dishes. 11!! And a complimentary sweet rice drink at the end. Yum.

This was a ton of food, and we were two people. Honestly, just one dish would probably have been more enough for two people, considering how many side dishes there were!

Nothing on its own blew my mind in particular (and I may have had better of the individual dishes elsewhere), but my experience and memories = Korean food feast, and who wouldn't want to revisit that?!
author: Shendi X.

description: This place gives BEST side dishes out of any Korean restaurant I've been to! If I lived closer I would definitely come here often. I ordered the beef and vegetable noodle soup. Overall it was very satisfying on a cold evening. This spot is a stop for Korean tour busses so if you're starving and want to eat ASAP, avoid this place when you see a bus parked out front.
author: Alison L.

description:
OOoooooohmyyyyyy GOODNESS GRACIOUS. These folks have Korean BBQ down to an ART FORM. I have so many good things to say about them.

For starters, the space is cool. It's down to earth, super casual, there are lots of families, and it's incredibly hole-in-the-wall in that it's 2 blocks off the 'beaten path' that is Geary Blvd.

Service was attentive - not particularly warm - but attentive and friendly enough. Plus, this place is really all about the food. 

Soooooo what did we try? We got a ton of Kalbi, Bulgogi, delicious noodles and kimchi pancakes. Everything was just so damn good. There were 3 of us and we kinda devoured it with the intent of finishing...and then didn't come close. It sounds expensive and it seems like you need to order a good amount, but I PROMISE you that you won't leave hungry. 

Wait for a table with a grill -- it's 100% worth the wait :) Also, they give you little cups of sweet rice water (not sure the proper name...) at the end that's nice and cleansing. I'll absolutely be going back.

Of the 50+ places I've tried in the city, this is now one of my top 5 favorite restaurants here. 

Don't hesitate. Don't compare it. Just go.
author: Andrea D.

description:
Went here with a large group of friends.  It was a good place to eat because we got everything family style, which made it easy to split the bill at the end of the night.
The food was delicious and the service was really good. They gave us a complimentary  soup because there were so many of us, and they gave us sweet rice water at the end of the meal. By the way - The sweet rice water was AMAZING!
author: Julianna I.

description:
Food is slightly above average Korean food for San Francisco which is not saying much since the Korean restaurants in SF are not even close to the ones in LA.
