KBBQ is one of my loves!  I absolutely love the many different banchans that they provide.  My favorite is the soybean sprouts, anchovies, cucumber, and the kimchi!  Their meats are well-marinated in amazing sauce.  Everything tastes delicious!

Though it is a bit pricey, I would love to come back here again.
author: Emi K.

description:
Holy shnikees! This place is so great. I'm not of Korean or even Asian descent..just your run-of-the-mill suburbanite that has fallen in love with all foods Asian. I thought Vietnamese was a good value.  Korean food is a crazy good value. 

The little apps that bring out as part of every meal were packed with flavor. Delicious Kim Chi and other wonderful little pickled items and cold beef bites. 

We had the seafood Bim Bop. For those who haven't had Bim Bop, you're  effing missing out. The rice...it's gets all crispy on the bottom and the meats stay hot and delicious.  Yum.  Sweet meats!

We also had noodles with beef. So good too. 

30 dollars for two people and we basically rolled out of the joint we were so stuffed.  Go to Han II Kwan now or never speak to me again.
author: Dusty B.

description: Solid KBBQ place in the city.  It's been hit or miss eating there since they're randomly super busy..probably doesn't help having the bus loads of people (literally) being dropped off there after a tour, I'm assuming.  We usually get the kalbi and pork belly.  It's good here, but nothing compared to LA KBBQ.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Han il Kwan is definitely in my top 5 Korean places I've ever eaten (especially since I haven't been to Korea). Service, quality of food, and price make it a spot that I will definitely continue to return to on a regular basis.

At first, when you look at the menu prices they will seem daunting. However, keep in mind, that most of the BBQ meats are portioned for 6-8 people per plate. Often times, large groups benefit from ordering from their set group menu since you get the widest selection of their menu. The Chap-Chae is absolutely delicious fresh out from the kitchen. The sizzling spicy pork and bulgogi waft into your nose and make you hunger for more. The bibimbap - yum! I have eaten here eaten here a few times, and I still haven't had everything on the menu. I look forwarding to eating it all.

Service is top notch for any restaurant. Servers are all very friendly, knowledgeable, and approachable.

Location is what you would expect for quiet little Richmond - very little parking, but accessible by bus, and tucked away among the apartments. and homes of the locals. My suggestion if you are driving out there is parking at Geary and 19th or Anza and 19th - you will have better luck. Also, it might help to walk off some of the calories gained from eating all the delicious food.

Finally, the restaurant itself is quite large as it sports the main dining room with several booths + large tables, and a back room with some more tables. I have yet to run into a tour group schedule, but you might consider calling ahead to check.

So yeah 5 stars.
author: Michael C.

description:
Place is usually packed!!
You might not always be able to get a grill, but at least you can get service.

Kalbi came out a little burned
Everything else, bulgolgi, marinated pork, and side dishes were spectacular.
They weren't stingy about refilling side dishes, but I kept having to ask them and instead of taking my empty dish, they brought out a new dish so we ended up having stacks of used dishes on our already small table for a party of 4.
author: Michael O.

description:
I pass this place all the time and finally had a chance to try it. I've actually been here twice and both times I lucked out and did not have to wait for a table. Of course, it probably helped that I got there after the lunch rush so maybe that's why I didn't have to endure the long wait times.

I've tried their Bulgogi, Short Ribs and Spicy Pork. Portions are big and tasty. Came with the standard banchan and also fried pancake and tofu soup. I actually got full from the banchan alone and would take my order home for a second meal.

They also have grills on the table where you can cook your own food. I'll have to go back with a group of friends to try this as that will make the experience more fun. 

Parking can be tough at times. And the parking directly in front of the restaurant is reserved for a tour bus. But with all the food they give you, it's probably better that you park a little further to help digest your meal anyways.
author: Mei C.

description:
Came here for my second time last Saturday.  I remember the first time I came I thought the food was really good, but it was only two of us so we couldn't explore as much as I wanted.  This time there were 3, SKY'S THE LIMIT!  After considering the Dinner A for six people, we thought it wise just to order a few things.

We settled on an order of Kalbi, Seafood and Kimchee Pancake, Kimchee and Pork Spicy Soup, and Clay Pot Bi Bim Bop!  Everything was delicious.  The Kalbi was cooked perfectly and was a good portioned size.  The Bi Bim Bop really stood out as everything blended in perfectly, with a perfect over easy egg top.  The crunchy rice at the bottom can only be had with the clay pot and adds extra depth to the dish,  The pancake and soup were both solid.  All portions were a good size.  

The other thing that stands out about this place over most of the other places in SF is the Banchan assortment.  It pretty much has all the essentials, and they threw in an a scrambled egg dish that was really good.  

I had made a reservation for 8 oclock for 4, be we were late and showed up with 3.  I had called to let them know that, and they were really accommodating!  We got seated right away!

I started this review at 4 stars, but when I think about.  I couldn't really knock them down for anything.  5 stars it is!  Best KBBQ in SF that I've had.
author: Veasna H.

description: Your average korean BBQ spot in SF but bigger portions than most places per serving. My family and I cam here together for my grandma's bday & ordered 5 orders of korean bbq & we usually finish it still not being satisfied but this place there were leftovers & we were totally stuffed! The staff was nice & persistent on exchanging our grill & their yummy extra included side dishes were delicious! I can help but be a sucker to my own cultures food. It was a great place to eat! I'm sure we will be back but on a schedule were time is not an option because the waiting period can get long.... and my mouth waters from smelling other customers food & watching them eat! Lol
author: Lisa S.

description:
My favorite Korean spot in SF.  Best deal.

Banchan are all super delish.  Especially the spicy anchovies.

Also gives us some pancake and tofu soup.  

Can't wait to come back soon.
author: Kevin L.

description:
We came here for a company holiday dinner. The service was quite fast (when you get their attention) and the food was delicious! 

Since we had a huge group, the dinner set was perfect as it helped everyone from trying to decide what to get and such. The portion was definitely more than enough, so don't let your eyes fool you! 

I only wished the tofu soup was a bit better, but maybe they're not specialized in that like some korean places are. I'd suggest going with BBQ plates here. 

At the end, they provided a dessert drink called Sikhye, made with barley malt powder and rice. This was very very refreshing!!!

Tip: Don't wear anything you don't want to smell in, it is a BBQ place so you will come out smelling like what you eat.
author: Ian C.

description:
I came back after 6 years! WOW That's such a long time.... I was still in college back then!

Anyways, the food still taste awesome! I did think the baby ribs were too chewy but I love their selection of banchan!! 

I think I might go tonight as I am writing this review :)
author: Shirley F.

description:
It pains me to give this place 2 stars, because the food is excellent. They bring out little bowls of all of these things to try, which honestly I didn't know what half of them were, but it was fun to try them all. Would have been nice if our server explained, and we couldn't flag down a server to do so. 

The service was god awful. Servers kept walking by and it became a game to see who could reel one in. They were in such a hurry. Understandable, but I don't want to wait 20+ minutes for more rice and a fork when I'm out to eat. 

The chili spicy tofu dish was amazing.
author: Jane R.

description: Yes, wait time for dinner is usually 20-30mins. This place has definitely improved through the years. Ban Cha's small plates good sized portions - i was impressed. Kalbi - kinda small portion. Mixed seafood was good! Probably my new go to place!
author: Thomas C.

description:
The food here is really delicious. Portions are large and food is delicious. 

We ordered:
Seafood pancake
Soon-du-bu 
Kalbi
Beef Rib Soup
Side dishes are really good

Service is on the slow side because they only have 2 waiters but food is amazing. It's a bit hard to get to without a car, but definitely worth it!
author: Lillian C.

description: I really like this place for Korean food in the Richmond. Been here a few times with large parties and they are very accommodating. Big portions, and very tasty. Will be back.
author: Ryan Y.

description: The people working there are crazy...  The food is pretty good but not worth the physical and psychological abuse I suffered today..
author: Alejandro M.

description:
Yook Gae Jang so good ($9.95). Bulgogi was pretty good too, but so expensive here - $20 for one order?!

Make sure you get the steamed egg side dish, it is seriously one of my favorite ban chans and very rare to come by.
author: Jess C.

description:
I came here on a weekday for lunch and surprisingly, unlike all other SF neighborhoods, it was very easy to find parking.  The place was about half full at 1:00 p.m., it seems like they were a little understaffed, but the two of us were seated in just a couple of minutes.  

We were ready to order soon after but it took about 15 minutes for anyone to come by our table again.  When we did order, the food came out rather quickly.  

Side dishes (free): bean sprouts, kim chi, cucumbers, tofu, something starchy/crunchy, pancake.  the sides were okay, nothing was spectacular though.  The pancake was probably my favorite item.

Beef rib eye ($10.50): the beef itself was a little bit dry and not that flavorful.  It wasn't bad, but not as good as I was hoping.  The portion is very fair though.  It came with a bowl of rice and a tofu soup too.  It is plenty of food for one person.

Seafood stone pot ($9.95): bits of seafood, and a fried egg, with rice.  You can add your own hot sauce and mix as desired.  I have never actually ordered this, but it was my friend's suggestion.  It was good and very filling.  The bits of crisped rice are the best.

Dessert (free): sugary-watery-rice.  It is served in a plastic cup and unlike anything I have ever had before, but I guess this is common with korean food.  It was a bit sweet for me, but my friend liked it.

Overall, the price is very fair and you get plenty of food (at least for lunch).  It's a decent option; but beware that the service can be a bit slow at lunch.  It took about 20 minutes to get the bill after we were done eating.  (We also asked for bowls during our meal, that we never got.)
author: Samantha L.

description: So Korean tour buses come here and they sit them before you although you have been waiting for over an hour. I get it they make you a lot of money. But what the fudge this is America. It's first come first serve not hook my friends up. Food sucks major D.
author: P D.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while looking for a meal on a Friday night in the Richmond.  It's located on Balboa and 19th Ave and is very unassuming as it's located in the middle of the more residential part of the Inner Richmond.  You can find street parking around the area, as there's not much going on commercially around the restaurant.

We stopped by in the middle of the dinner rush (around 8 pm) and had a to wait only a short while before we were seated.  There's surprisingly a lot of space and it can fit large parties (we had a group of 6).  However, after we sat down, it seemed that we had to a wait a while to get any service (taking our order, receiving our food, getting our side dishes).  Pretty understandable giving the crowded dining time.

I had a combination of the Soft Tofu soup and  Stone Pot Bibimbap.  Both were very excellent and provided a nice complement to one another.  For the soft tofu soup, it came out piping hot, so be aware of cooling it off a little before guzzling it down.  It was just the right amount of kick, but still very flavorful.  The Bibimbap was very standard and you could add as much hot sauce as you would like.  I suggest also adding in some kim chee or the other sides to add to the dish.  As for my friends, they thoroughly enjoyed their meals ranging from the squid stir fry, to a noodle dish, to kalbi.  We also had a side of hot sake which really helped to let the good time role.

As with all Korean BBQ places, be ready for your entire body and clothes to absorb the korean food smell for the rest of your day/night.  However, it's always worth it to satisfy your taste buds!
author: Robert T.

description: Went here for lunch for a birthday party.  There were four of us.  Service is okay and forgetful so constantly remind them that you are there and you need stuff.  We ordered the cook-it-yourself beef and chicken, seafood pancake, seafood spicy soup for a total of over $100.  Mind you the beef itself is $29,99 an order.  They do overload you with condiments such as the sprouts, kim chee, pancake, tofu and several others.  You might be pleased with that. They had good unique tea and the ice water was fresh.  Cooking the beef was simple but the chicken takes a while.  Korean is very expensive and very filling especially the pancakes.  Suggestion:  I would skip the pancake overall at this place.  I went to Soju tonight and their pancake was light and greasy but here at Han Il Kwan the pancakes are very heavy.  If you do order the pancakes, save it for last and get your fill on all the protein and veggies first or else you won't eat anything else.  The spicy soup was overloaded with scallops and octopus.  It also had shrimp, mussels and fish i think.  Very good.  Although it is like $18 but if you love seafood, this is a good item to purchase because you kind of get your $$$'s worth.  A very good friend mentioned that this place is expensive and indeed it is.  I'm sure there are other reasonable Korean joints out there, we just have to find them.  Enjoy!!!
author: Chris S.

description: This is a nice Korean BBQ place to come to. My family had to wait 30 mins until we were seated though, and there was barely any room to wait inside. The side dishes were delicious. We ordered the Gal-Bi beef and that was super good as well. The pork belly was  crispy but quite fatty. In addition, we also got the seafood pan fried and that was great. Overall, the price is a little more expensive than I expected. The service was decent, and I wish the workers were more friendly and smiley.
author: Eva H.

description:
Han Il Kwan doesn't give a shit about you unless you live 5000 miles away and arrive on a tour bus.

Waited in line for 50 minutes to witness a third bus arrive, people pile into the restaurant and get seated. They don't care about anyone's time or have the decency to put a closed sign up or warn regulars. We promptly left.

Will never go back or recommend it to anyone.
author: Easwud C.

description:
I disagree with the 4-star review on this place I see here. This is my summary of this restaurant: that restaurant that tour buses stop by just because they have contracts with Korean tourist agencies. Nothing more. I am Korean, I love Korean food, and I have eaten at many different Korean places around the world. This place is a solid 2-star restaurant. We got 10 banchans (side dishes), which is relatively generous around the Bay Area. However, that was the end of anything good about this place. 
We had four people in the party, and each person's food arrived at different times with an average of 10 minute intervals. So by the time I  done with my Naeng Mying, my husband was still waiting for his Galbee tang. 
So was the food at least good? No. Galbee tang was so bland that we had to ask for salt. Naengmyung arrived without vinegar and mustard, and I had to ask for it twice before I got them. 
Banchans refill is an essential part of Korean dining. We asked for the refills precisely 5 times over 45 min period, and we finally got our banchans refilled. The only thing is that we were all done by the time banchans arrived. We could have stayed for dinner to finish the banchans, but we were finished with this place by then.

I guess the serving ladies have super sensors for customer disappointment (or this is always expected?). We were given a freebie dish. But sorry, that didn't up the stars.
author: Jane M.

description:
HANDS DOWN FAV KOREAN PLACE IN SF. Always come out full, satisfied, and happy! I like to come on the weekdays to avoid the tour buses on the weekends because on weekdays, youll get major discounts on meat during LUNCH SPECIAL (until 4 pm), and it will be crowded with tour buses.

Service is NICE! The place is roomy and clean! I usually like to order bulgogi for $10, tofu soup for $8 or $10, and glass noodles for $15. I must say, the noodles dont taste as good anymore. The bulgogi is sweet, filling and chewy. The tofu soup is not too bland or too spicy and it has lots of veggies in it :). They gave us free assorted dishes and a stone pot of steamed egg WHICH I LOVE! It never fails to make me want more because of how slippery and soft it is. for 2 meats, glass noodles, and tofu soup, it cost us $45 ONLY! i will always look forward to coming back!
author: Josie D.

description:
Pros: 
- Really good food
- Really good banchans
- Really good service
- Open later than most places around this area
- Cook-it-yourself BBQ, but really, they come by and cook your food for you if you're slow
- If you get take out, they give you all the fixins: soup and banchans

Cons:
- They're crowded so the wait can be a long for a BBQ table
- Expensive. One order of kalbi take out costed me $30!
author: LeTran B.

description:
So, I'm a Korean from So Cal where there is an abundance of Korean businesses such as markets, boutiques, bakeries, bars/sooljibs and of course restaurants.  Even down in So Cal I never really go out to eat at Korean restaurants just because I don't see the point in paying money for food I can eat for free at home where the quality of ingredients surpasses any restaurant in LA and is made with extra love from mom.  ;] 

However, for some reason before I went on my last trip to SF I had the biggest craving for dolsot bibimbap (mixed rice with veggies, meat, egg and spicy chili paste cooked in a stone bowl).  I tried to ignore my craving, hoping it would subside after a few days, but no... I had to surrender.  

To be honest I was a little wary of going to eat Korean in SF as competition isn't that high amongst Korean restaurants as it is in LA so one might think that their A game is equivalent to LA's B game in regards to Korean food.  I did however, take note that Han Il Kwan has an impressive rating on Yelp that made me a little more comfortable of trying it out.  

Service was okay to good.  The older lady was alright and got the job done when it came to waitressing... the younger male was really cool & friendly towards my friend and I without giving us a stink face when we asked for extra banchan.

So here's the low down on the show down...

Dolsot Bibimbap - lunch portion was a huge portion... came with all the usual suspects of assorted veggies, pieces of beef, rice, fried egg and a squirt bottle of Korean chili paste.  I asked for a little side of sesame oil as I couldn't taste any when I took my first bite.  Overall it was a standard bowl of dolsot bibimbap, tasting better after I added the oil in combination with my heavy load of chili paste.  Not out of this world and not unsatisfying as if definitely satiated my craving.

Kalbi - It was okay... I don't know if it's because I've been spoiled with my mom's own need to make kalbi every time she sees that short ribs are on sale at the market or if because my tastebuds have become jaded living in LA.  Not disgusting, not amazeballs... more like a.."these shall do" kind of reaction.

Tofu soup - (Not soon tofu, but a spicy soup with veggies & tofu) Comes free with your lunch meal, I was pleasantly surprised with this soup.  Usually I don't really like soups like these so I didn't really taste my portion till later on in my meal.  It was quite tasty with the chunks of zucchinis I really enjoyed and a perfect side to go with my bibimbap.

Nokdoboochim (pancake) - It's always a plus for me when a restaurant gives any type of Korean style pancake as a complimentary appetizer.  These were the kind made out of grounded beans, they might have been free but they tasted like they were worth paying for. 

Banchan - Typical side dishes you'd get at any Korean spot...acorn jelly with seasoned soy sauce, kimchi, sautéed oden, bean sprouts/soy beans sprouts, pickled veggies, and I forget what others.  None of them really stood out for me, but then again I was more focused on attacking my entree which was seriously a big portion.  

After meal dessert drink (shikhye) - For real, super brownie points after giving the BEST Korean drink -better than soju, makgoli, bekseju, mekju, etc.  Sweet malted rice drink...the Korean's version of horchata perhaps???  BOMB.  No better way to end a Korean feast.  

I don't know if I'll come back just because I still don't know how I feel about eating Korean in SF when I can just drive over to Ktown in LA where each restaurant is competing with the restaurant next door specializing in the same damn thing as them.    My meal, overall was standard, nothing blew me out of the water...okay maybe the dessert beverage did, but hey that should just be the icing on the cake right?  I suppose if I were to be randomly craving Korean in SF again this would be my first pick because service was good and the food didn't disappoint.
author: Priscilla C.

description:
I was referred by a friend and was excited to try this place out. My 3 friends and I were extremely disappointed with the service, the food, and the overall dining experience. 
It took us over 15 min for us to be seated when there was plenty of open tables in the restaurant. When we finally were, the waitress didn't come over for almost 15 min after we flagged her down. She was helping other tables and they were getting their food before we were even able to be assisted. We had a few questions about the menu and every time we asked one, she would answer and then run away. She never offered anything else to drink and was extremely short when answering our questions. Our order was finally taken after 30 min. 
The food was extremely oily, burnt, and completely unsatisfying. 
When paying, we did not leave a tip because of the experience, and as we were walking out, she proceeded to yell at us, "No Tip!?"  One of my friends told her we didn't enjoy the experience and she appeared to be mind blown. 
Afterwards, we were all sick. I don't recommend.
author: Cheyenne N.

description: Person on the phone didn't answer my questions and just hung up on me in the middle of a sentence. My first time calling, great service /s.
author: Lee T.

description:
Been here with my wife 3 or 4 times. Great value for the $. For two people, all you need to order is one meat dish. You get free tofu soup, rice, and unlimited refills on the side dishes.

It's interesting watching the busloads of Korean tourists piling in... as soon as one tour bus departs, another one pulls in.

As for service, you have to understand the wait staff get almost no break as wave after wave of customers keep them slammed. They do the best they can and considering the strain they're under, they're actually quit amazing. If you decide to add to your order, expect it to arrive late since in the time between your first order and your second order, they probably got 20 other orders that need to be taken care of first.

This is our go-to restaurant for Korean food for now.
author: Gene G.

description:
Bad f**king services ...

We go in - a party of 7- and they tell us to wait... They start cleaning the table of 4s.. And we were the only ones in line and the place was half empty.. 
After waiting 10 mins we ask again.. When are you going to seat us.. And they say in 20-30 mins.. We asked them can't we take the 2 table of 4s and they said no because we are a party of 7 and we have to wait... I asked them why can't you split us.. You have a lot of empty tables... And they said no because we are a party of 7 ... Wtf

One more thing... We asked why didn't you tell us and they said cause you didn't ask.. Really... The restaurant was half empty... And most tables were empty and just needed to get cleaned..

F@&king... Mustache dude looks like a pedophile!!!!
author: Jenny H.

description: This is my go-to Korean place when I'm in the City. It's the place I go to when I'm not in the mood to try new places. The meat serving is enough for an average person's appetite. I don't feel rushed here to leave as soon as I finish. The jjigae is nicely spiced. I don't know what else to say, it's really good and I love it here.
author: Stacy C.

description:
While the food was tasty we felt that there may have been a bit of a racial profile made against us in the service we received. While the other groups of mostly Koreans trucked in on tour buses received exemplary service from the staff, we were left waving our arms in attempt to get a water refill, check the status of our meals, and for a box for our leftovers.

Other than the service, we really did like the food. We ordered a kimchi pancake for the table and we all were really impressed with the complex flavor of the dish. We all sampled each others dishes, from bulgogi to bibimbap. The meal also included a tasty soup that we all loved and an interesting sweet rice drink to close out our meal.
author: Liz G.

description: I was always under the impression that we didnt have good kbbq up in NorCal. My friend mentioned this place in the sunset so we came here around 8pm on a friday. We only had to wait about 10 minutes for a bbq table. Between the 3 of us we ordered the galbi and the pork belly. I really liked the galbi. My friend loved the pork belly. I really wanted the beef brisket but they unfortunately ran out =( we also got the beef bone soup which was also really good. It went really well with the meal. if you're craving korean bbq in the city, I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Annie Z.

description:
This has been my favorite Korean BBQ restaurant in SF for years... But last night was the last time i will be dining there... Through out the years we have been coming here to dine and I refered so many people, tourists, friends to this restaurant, but from now on, i will just tell them NOT WORTH IT.
*Last couple times, no matter what time you come, they ALWAYS have tour buses. And no, its not just 1... I remember arriving at 5, 6, 7, and i wait for 1+ hour minimum each time. At least 3 tour buses rolling in each time, 20 mins for each bus, cleaning, 20 mins, cleaning and another 20 mins... They dont seat anyone during this time, maybe couple tables... But they seat tourist all around restaurant and it just seems like a Sunday Farmers market, while we all scrumble and stand around the door, trying to all fit and not be in the way...
*Yesterday night we arrived at 7 pm. Due to tour bus and parking, 4 people of our party of 6 went in to put the name down, i circled 5-6 times, which is at least 15 mins to find a parking. Parked, went in, i wanted to ask how long is the wait. So i asked the owner, he was like i dont even know, we have buses, people waiting and some reservations! So i dont know. Ok... He was like well, at LEAST 45 mins... OK. I looked at the waitlist, we were maybe the 5-7th in the row. And behind us were at Least 5-7 parties. So like middle of the line. It was so crowded inside, the tour bus was wrappling up, they will start seating reservations and people, so we were outside. It was an exceptional HOT day in SF, over 80, almost 85 all the way, and suddenly it started cooling off. We did have jackets and stuff, but it was coming down to 60, a bit windy. We kept going in every 5-10 mins to check on the line. Even we left the phone number, i dont recall them ever calling. At 8 pm, its been an hour, we asked again how much more, the owner says, like i told you around 7:30, 45 mins, its gonna be 15 more mins... I understand, but he didnt know we put our names way 30 mins before that! So 1 hour in, he says another 15 mins. Ok. We went inside to wait, because the party of 5 after us on the list are standing right at the counter and pushing and trying to get seated before. 
Over 20 mins passed, he seats us at this BIG round table. Which fits 10-12 people. We asked for a BBQ table. So i kindly walk to owner and ask him can u get us any of those 2 side tables, the ones by the window, the cooking ones, there were 2 empty, they are cleaning them. So I explain to him our party of 6 includes 2 kids, 1 is 3, another is 7, its gonna be really hard for them to reach anything! We want to long narrow table, so it would be easier for parents and for kids. Plus, it was windy, and they keep the door wide open! And our table was right by the door, the kids were sick last couple weeks, adjusting to SF weather, can we get the table by the windows, so it doesnt blow on your back! 5 mins debate, he was rude and kept saying no! And excuse was those tables are reserved. Specificaly those. Can u give ours to them? No. Because they only have 3 people, but we have kids, can you please understand its to hard for them to reach any salad plates. No no and no. Which is ok. We seat down. But wait for it...! The party of 5 after us got seated at the non cooking table... After 5 mins, he seats them to that reserved table! Are you kidding me!?!? This is absolutely RUDE!!! Of course we were mad! So we call a server and tell her, this is not fair, why they got moved there, if you say it was not available, make it off limits to everyone! At this point, the server tells another server in Korean, then they go talk to owner... And guess what he did?! HE WAIVED HIS HAND AT US LIKE I DONT GIVE A SH***!!! And the server who came back was the one served us many many times, really nice lady, she says apology, but they had reservation... Hm...No.. They were there the whole time! Excuse me, but purple/blue plaid shirt is kinda noticeble, who is just at the counter each time i check the list! So she says, oh, i dont know, sorry for this... Honestly, at that point of couse we didnt say anything, since the owner was so big on customer service, what if he kick us out, if we didnt have my uncle's family of 4 with us, we would of left! But the kids were so tired and hungry after the day visit in SF, they wanted to try this amazing korean bbq and go back. We ordered, eat, dissapointed, still leave a decent tip, even i feel like i would tip for than 10% for this bullshit, and said GOODBYE to this place. 
*Food was so blend and flavorless. We ordered Kalbi, Marinated Rib Eye, Pork belly, a fried fish, fried noodles, hot stone bi bim bap, kimchee jiigae, Yukgaejang. Meat were fine. Fish was not chewy, not good at all. Bi bim bap wasnt tasty at all. Kimchee was not spicy at all, and my favorite yukgaejang was so flavorless. 
Hey, if you cant handle people, reservation and tour bus, dont do them all!! I did call for reservation, they said the dont take any!
author: Nataly S.

description: My go to Korean Spot in SF.  They're known for the wide variety of ban chan, before the meats come.  Be sure to order the Kalbi...and order the one that you can grill on the table if you're hungry.    It may cost a little more, but you'll get a bigger plate.
author: mike j.

description:
Short rib stew all the way EVERY DAY. It's magic! :D

The stew comes with the bones and the waitress cuts the meat from the bones. The meat is melty and flavorful. The potato and carrot are perfect complements to the short ribs. And the gravy! Ask for a container and take it home to enjoy the next day. :)
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I'll never return to Han Il Kwan. I've grown tired of arriving at this restaurant when it's virtually empty at the start of dinner only to be told my party cannot be seated because they're expecting another bus load of tourists from Korea. On top of that, the interior is just not very clean or well kept in general. The service is spotty to mediocre.

It's too bad. This is probably the most LA-quality Korean food in SF. That's what gets this place 2 instead of 1 star.

I just don't get it. When you travel 1/2 way around the world, wouldn't you want to try the local cuisine?
author: Jason G.

description: Banchan aplenty. Free soon doo boo. Huge mound of galbi. Tasty dessert drink. Yam nam nam nam nam.
author: Mandy H.

description: Great place! I was trying to eat here a few months ago but it was really hard to find parking nearby so I gave up. Tonight I came again and luckily parked my car (why am I driving again?). It's a modestly decorated place but everything is very nice. All the appetizer dishes are tasty, the service was fast, waitresses very attentive and kind. We ordered spicy rice cake (tteokbokki) and beef rib soup (galbitang), the beef ribs were beyond description, very tender and juicy, impressively tasty. Knowing that we were visiting for the first time, we got a steamed egg one-pot on house. The meal came with a sweet rice wine drink as dessert at the end. The price was also very reasonable. Definitely will come again.
author: Tian W.

description: This place 100% only cares about making money. Ive never been to a Korean bbq place where they didnt change our grills in spite of the thick layer of black tar and burnt fat that had accumulated. The worst part of eating here is the extremely poor quality of meat they use. Growth hormones and antibiotics in beef? Eating here makes me feel like I just shortened my life by a few years. Best part is the tour bus parking out front so no customers can park. For the huge tour buses of tourists arriving at their door ferreted into a back room so they can make more money. Horrendous restaurant.
author: Sebastian C.

description: Lunch price is excellent for grilled tender meats, banchan, rice & sikhye! $25 for 2 people and tummies happily full!
author: judy l.

description: I'm from phoenix. I love kbbq in LA and thought I'd give it a try in San Francisco. This place is awesome because it exceeded my expectations! Great food! Top tier!
author: Andrew S.

description: When we walked in, the hostess was busy conversing with someone so we sat ourselves. The same lady brought us our menus and then left. For the next 15 minutes, she completely ignored my bf and I as she walked from table to table checking on all of the other Asian-occupied tables. She even took the order of customers that (were Asian) arrived after us. At that point my bf was done and ready to leave, as he felt a lack of respect. But I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt, and waited for her to come to our table. However after she took the order of the people that came after us, she started walking away and then another lady waved her down and told her to come to our table. However, she walked right past our table and then when I tried to get her attention she put her hand up to keep me from speaking because she was helping the people next to us. I was finally ready to leave at that point. I stood up to leave and the lady finally asked me what I wanted and I just told her we were leaving. Never coming to this place again. Reviews are deceiving!!!
author: Karoline A.

description: This place has great seafood pancakes!  The other BBQ and dishes are okay.  A bit pricey, but still one of my favorites in the Richmond District.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
One of the best Korean restaurants in SF! They have amazing bbq and also side dishes (even though the bibimbap was a bit below par). 

We got the special combo A for 6 people and it was definitely more than enough food. You can swap out some of the items for others (which is a plus). 

Also the Korean sweet rice drink as the dessert is amazing!!
author: Grace Q.

description:
The food is very good, the banchan is fantastic and the service is amazing.  We were promptly seated for dinner and were a little worried when they mentioned a tour bus was coming.  We decided to order as quickly as possible to get our order into the kitchen before the tour showed up.  Everyone working here is on top of there game because we had our food when the tour buses showed up and the service didn't slow.  They had kept up their pace, continued their attentive service, and rotated the tour groups in/out.  Amazed by the way they churn and burn.

The kalbi was marinated just right, but think it did lack in quality a bit.  Will get it again if I have a taste for kalbi, otherwise I'll explore other menu items.

The spicy pork was outstanding.  I will be back (dine-in/carryout/doesn't matter) for this dish alone.  I ended up taking the left overs home and this was even better the next day.

Well worth another visit if I'm in the mood for Korean.
author: Zoran L.

description:
Portions are great.
One of my favorite Korean spots in the city.

Beware the tour bus tho....
author: Johnny C.

description:
The best korean food I have in town. Or Maybe my taste bud isn't as good as most other people? 

Their lunch special is awesome! It gets busy during lunch time for sure. 

Sometimes you'll see Korean tourists bus dropping off hundreds of tourists, how can you go wrong??
author: Hong L.

description: love this place. can be pretty crowdy on Friday nights, obviously!!! their food comes out average timely. love their bibimbap and kimchi jige. this is one of the very few places that serves dagturitan - my favorite. i wish they had served some kinds of chicken wings!
author: Duke B.

description:
A group of friends and I came here for dinner one Friday evening, per the suggestion of Yelp. We had to wait a short while, but were seated in a reasonable manner. However, throughout the dinner, I felt that the service could have been a but faster and more attentive, but that is probably because the restaurant was really busy at that time. Whatever the deal was with the service, certainly was made up with the food!

There was a nice variety of starter sides were that were very fresh and savory. (We asked for more but they never came back though :( ) My friend and I ordered a soft tofu soup and hot stone pot bibimbap to share. The bibimbap was pretty yummy - piping hot and savory. The soft tofu soup was very spicy (for me!), but the white rice helped balance that out immensely. Overall, I would recommend to come to this place for yummy, delicious food - just be prepared for the slower service.
author: Hurnan V.

description:
This place is great! You get a bunch of banchan dishes and I even got some of the pancakes complimentary! They also gave spicy soup.

I tried the kalbi and spicy pork. The dishes were good and had a nice smokey flavor, but I felt it was missing that extra oomph to make it really good. They make up with it by how big the portions are.

The best part of the experience was at the end when they give you a sweet rice drink!

The service is good and the restaurant is clean. Its hard to find parking here but thats San Francisco for you.
author: Argent I.

description:
This place still rocks after all this time. The manager even threw in dishes on thr house. Way to go Han Il Kwan!! 

.... And the beef stew is the best!
author: Kevin N.

description:
This is the best Korean BBQ I have ever had. Hands down. Rarely have I gone to a restaurant at this price point and enjoyed every dish put in front of me. But this happened last night.
In particular, we were very impressed with the spicy beef cheek (bulgogi) which we cooked at the table, as well as the mung bean pancake, the marinated chicken (also cooked tableside), and of course, about a million side dishes including tofu soup, which came with the meal. We didn't think we could finish it all at first, but by the end, there was nothing to take home. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Scott H.

description:
If you are not Korean, expect super slow service. If you are Korean, you will get great service. The food is pretty good here and portions are decent. 

If you order meat dish it comes with a tofu soup. Really good. Kalbi was tender and flavorful. Chicken wasn't bad. Seafood pancake and the raw beef with egg are my favorites. Love their little side dishes they give. Fish Cake and yellow pickle are my 2 favorites. 

They also have private rooms in the back that can hold 30 to 40 people.
author: Karen H.

description:
It was our first time here for sister bday on friday 13th around 7 pm. Place was pack and it was a 45 min wait for a self bbq table.
It was worth the wait. Had a party of five and did the package order that says its good for six people. We were skeptical if it would be enough for the five and boy it was, with little left over to go.
Everything was good. Including the sides. Everyone was surprise and satisfied with the flavor.
It was a long wait for a table but food came out quickly, one right after the other.
We did encounter a waitress that did seem a little pushy and rude as other reviews have mentioned which I found funny.
Overall great experience with the food and nice atmosphere to enjoy the food with your people.
Sister: "meat melts in your mouth"
Boyfriend: "this the best meal ive had in a while." 5x
author: T M.

description:
Came here for the first time the other day and it is definitely now one of my favorite Korean Places in SF. 

The prices seemed a bit high at first, but they give you lots of side dishes (banchan) and the portions sizes are really great. They also seem to frequently give a complimentary steamed egg dish, which is really tasty. 

The Seafood Pancake was great, and we also got the Kimchee Tofu soup with Pork. Both were delicious, and the portion sizes were fantastic, we had enough to take home for another meal.
author: Yishian Y.

description:
My favorite KBBQ in the bay area and closest thing to LA. (well, not even close but the quality of meat and banchan is on point) Nothing can compare to LA bbq!!

This unassuming Kbbq place sits on a residential discreet corner in the avenues in SF.

I hadnt tried it in many years and decided to go again. wow was I impressed!

For 2 pl we got 2 meats - generally the kalbi and pork belly

both cuts are superior in quality and quanitity to the crap you get at places like Yakiniq. Did I mention I will never go to Yakiniq again? Their quality has gone downhill so badly I wonder what kind of roadkill they are serving. Honestly that place is only good for young kids who are half drunk from soju who will cram anything down their mouths. That's not me, sorry. I will pay a bit more for quality meat.

The banchan is extensive here and they make their own tofu skin. They give you comp steamed egg.

had the spicy rice cakes here too once and it was delish.

Any of the meats will be a safe bet and make sure you eat it with the garlic, jalopeno and bean paste (req on side) and lettuce wrap. SO good!
You will smell but if you smell together its not so bad!

The place always has korean tour buses parked outside with tour groups- so you know its authentic korean- good enough for those ajimas, good enough for me!

my go to spot for kbbq in SF always.
author: Petri Y.

description: Worst service ever!! Gave us boxes and check when we weren't even done eating!! Keep staring at us and try to make us leave sooner so they can give the table to larger party!! I wish I could give no star for this restaurant. If you care about customer service, don't ever go.
author: Eva L.

description:
4.5 rating on non-hot pot visits. 

any place that serves you complimentary  food warms my heart. not only do they give you about 8 those delicious side dishes, they also drop off potato pancakes and this egg soup thing that will just about fill you up!

the first visit was during dinner with my mom. tho the house was packed with people and smoke from the hot pot tables, we were seated within minutes of arriving. I wish I got the name of my server, he was such a sweetheart!

we ordered 3 things - mom had classic bibimbap (w beef), shared the seafood pancake, and i had the combination seafood tofu soup.

bibimbap - came stone hot (yes, HOT and not cold in this case)! I've tasted my share of bibimbaps and you know how sometimes the rice would be SUPER mushy, especially after mixing the veggies/egg/sauce? well this was super bomb, not mushy at all and the crispy rice at the bottom was, well, crispy .. and not just super chewy. 

seafood pancake - about 2 pieces of this really will fill you up. this came in 8-10 pieces, are pretty heavy and served with this tasty dipping sauce. Pieces of octopus were sprinkled within along with long pieces of green onions. so good!!

combo seafood tofu soup - wasn't listed on the menu so I asked and I received! BEST TOFU SOUP EVER. PERIOD. you have to wait like, 10 minutes to eat it though cause it comes smokin hot! I advise using the little plates they give you to help cool your soup. otherwise you'd never leave the place. in the soup were bits and pieces of octopus, clam whole 2-3 pieces of shrimp and duh, tofu. in every bite I had the perfect melody of seafood and tofu. never wished once that there was more of one or the other. oh, and i don't recall it being super spicy either, which is good on my end cause I'm not a huge fan of spicy. however if you are, I'm sure they'd be more than happy to accommodate. 

so uh, first time here, we obviously didn't know how much food this would be!!! long story short we barely made a dent in our plates and packed the rest! I had enough lunch for another dinner and 2 lunches!!

to top off this great experience, they serve this home made sweet rice drink. ok, it was weird at first. I know there are rice puddings and rice desserts out there but this was like, white rice which my palate associates w savory. I drank the water part of it - no joke about the sweet! I tried the rice and my first thought as I chewed was .. paper. you know when you chew paper to throw spitballs? it was kind of that consistency, only this you swallow and not spit out. it was interesting, new, and tasty!

I've been back twice since, and actually plan to take my parents there today for lunch!

ps - parking is a b*tch, but what's new in the rich?
pps - expect to walk out of there smelling like korean bbq.
author: Rica R.

description:
One of my favorite Korean places. I'm currently on a strict diet #whole30 I can not have anything with sugar added or soy...The waiter was very nice and tild me what I could and can't eat out of the little dishes :) 

I had unmarinated pork belly and unmarinated short ribs all very good!

I survived my 1st day eating out on this diet and I was relieved they didn't think I was a pain in the ass foe asking..is there sugar in this?..is there soy in this??
author: Karen T.

description: Great food and fun atmosphere - definitely one of the better korean bbq restaurants I've been to.  Highly recommend if you're around the area
author: Doug I.

description:
Stumbled into this place with my gf as we were touring San Fran.  
Very friendly inside and excellent food and service.
author: Alex G.

description:
I stumbled upon this gem when my friends and I were trying to go to Tofu House for a weekend lunch but found it closed.  I was very happy to find Han Il Kwan though!  

My first time was with a group of 4 and we came at an odd lunch hour, so it wasn't crowded at all.  We ordered the seafood pancake, spicy hot beef soup, kimchee tofu soup, and clay pot bibimbop.  I'm not sure if it's because we were super hungry, but we were really satisfied and happy with most of the food!  I ordered the tofu soup, which was subpar, to myself but had buyer's remorse when I saw my friend's spicy hot beef soup.  Everything was a huge portion though so we were plenty full and had lots of leftovers at the end.

Second time was recently when I went with a bigger group for dinner, so reservations had to be made.  This time I made sure to order the spicy beef soup and shared the bibimbop with a friend.  It might've been the fact that it get super packed for dinner, but the soup wasn't as good as I remembered.  Bibimbop, in general, never really stands out to me but I couldn't complain about Han Il Kwan's version.  

The reason my review is mostly neutral but I'm giving it 4 stars though is because of it's banchan.  You could get full off of just that if you wanted because they give you SO MUCH!  I love the variety and it's because of Han Il Kwan that I can eat kimchee by itself now (always had to have it with something else before).  I start drooling just thinking of their banchan.  They don't have yogurt soju though, but plain soju is readily available.  Also, servers and everyone were very helpful and attentive!
author: Jane N.

description:
Not even worth a star. Ordered bowl of rice and takes 35min to come out. 
Totally doesn't give a shit about customers waiting. Doesn't even apologize for their mistakes. 
Total different attitude towards our table and others. 
Servers literally avoids our table.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Dericious. 

Not only do they have delicious Beef Bulgogi, but the kimchi is excellent.

Was very happy with the service, despite be it being a little sparse due to the restaurant being packed. They were helpful, cheerful, and very quick with the drinks.

One thing I was especially surprised with: the fact that they give you so much complimentary little plates of pickled food and don't mind you asking for more if you finish them. All included.

Yes please. I'll definitely be taking the adventurous drive back into the deep Richmond for this place, especially when I have picky friends who I want to keep guessing.
author: Anthony B.

description:
korean food by koreans for koreans.

if you're looking for all-you-can-eat, stuff your face bbq, look elsewhere. probably will need to anyways because street parking around there is horrible and this place can get crowded. recommend the bbq, the prepared foods are pretty average...
author: Sherman L.

description: Definitely one of my favorite korean spots in the city ! The lunch specials are awesome too. Good food but sometimes parking can be a little tough so come early !
author: Andre S.

description: Delicious BBQ and endless free side dishes. We live in the neighborhood and got the sense that it was fairly authentic when we often saw busloads of Korean tourists visited there. It is usually a long line after 6pm for a handful of BBQ grill tables. Expect avg. one hour wait. It is good for large group because for each BBQ table you need to order two BBQ meat dishes, which is too much for my boyfriend and me. The upside, apparently, is that they serve large portions! We have brought friends from the south bay or even Australia there, they loved it!
author: Fang X.

description:
We order the spicy cold noodle, the cold noodle and the hot stone pot bibimbap. They were meehhh. Cold noodles with light beef broth were super bland, just noodles, 1 slice of beef and some slices of pickle radish the broth was just like water... no flavor whatsoever. Unless that's how you like your cold noodles... just full of water and noodles with no distinctive flavor... perfect for someone who is watching out for their sodium levels... or any flavor level. But don't do it if you have diabetes, because one thing this dish is full of ... are noodles.  Cold spicy noodles were standard nothing amazing, just noodles with tons of typical red spicy paste.  Perfect for your MSG loving friend. Bibimbap, hot with rice and veggies perfect for your typical korean food newbie... because they don't know better.
Also perfect if you want to eat some side dishes and never want get seconds because their waiters are super attentive and fast.
And perfect date spot specially for that special date with that special someone you don't ever want to see again... but you will save money because they offer complimentary soft tofu soup per table. So order up one expensive ass dish to share and eat up the side dishes (don't expect refills) and the free soft tofu soup to your heart's content. ^____^
author: Suzanne L.

description: Pork belly was good, but strikes for not having the thin sliced brisket. Also thumbs down to our crappy server who is the honey badger of waitresses, she just didnt give a shit (see pic) We asked for a couple different things repeatedly, she just decided she was gonnna ignore us. Thankfully, the other waitress was pleasant enough.
author: Beast L.

description: Came here for lunch today.  Great meal, the staff is very nice. The mrs & friend had the seafood bibimbap.  I had the short ribs.  Grabbed a Korean beer too.
author: Funnywino W.

description: Decent Korean BBQ. I took a group of friends out there and they loved it. We definitely stayed past their closing time but they made no mention of it whatsoever. I appreciated that. The side dishes were numerous and delicious.
author: Jean L.

description: First time at this restaurant, last weekend.  They will only take a reservation made 2+ days in advance, so we had to wait about 40 minutes for a table.  Multiple tour buses came and went during our wait, and the place was CROWDED, to the point there was nearly no place to stand, and the line to the restroom was about 15 deep.  However the staff were clearly working quickly and efficiently to clear and set tables -- an impressive operation!  When we finally sat down, we ordered (for the 6 of us) the prix fixe meal for "up to 6 people".  Thinking that may be a light meal, we ordered a few additional dishes.  In reality, the basic family style meal for 6 would have been more than enough.  It was all quite good, and very interesting (not being an expert on Korean food).  One of those at our table is ethnically Korean, and she agreed that the food was all excellent and very authentic/traditional.  I would definitely love to go back, but preferably with a reservation, and at a time when the tour buses aren't arriving!
author: Fred E.

description:
My favorite korean place in the city. Love their Kalbi and Pork Bulgogi. Terrific job with the banchan. It's terrific that they gift you soft tofu soup. Service is decent. Price is a bit on the high side compared to other Korean places. 

Lastly, I love their seafood pancakes... definitely worth a try!
author: Michael C.

description: It is a very foreign restaurant with very cultural foods. Not many good foods fit for kids. The bathrooms were not very clean. The place was smaller than usual. They had many options of food. The service was well and friendly. I'd say it's worth to going to, maybe not with your kids. I may come back.
author: Connor B.

description:
So after suggesting we come here for lunch recently, I've concluded that this is the best Korean food I've eaten so far, in SF. lol. 

Spicy Pork. Jap Chae. Delicious to the extreme. Super flavorful and not bland like other places. Filling lunch portions. SP was just spicy enough and the JC was definitely not super oily and just smooth enough! 

I think I definitely forgot to mention that they serve delicious side dishes. 
There's a whole bunch of the stuff you usually get at Korean restaurants (kimchi, cucumbers, bean sprouts, etc). 
But they also serve the.. egg pancake thing? I'm sorry, I really don't know what it's called but I'll ask my friend (who is Korean and loves this place too) and get back to you all... 
But it's like, something you don't normally get served in SF Korean restaurants (or ones I've been to, at least). 
Oh, and I love the sweet rice drink at the end.. (:

Still haven't tried the BBQ yet, but I will. Someday. Soon. Hopefully. o_o"
author: Susan Y.

description: One of the best Korean restaurants in San Francisco. Discovered it a few years back and I always come back whenever I'm craving Korean food. The first time I came with friends, there was a really kind Korean server. He helped us cut our food properly and taught us how to eat certain dishes. Back then we also had pancake along with tofu soup on the house. The last few times I was here, it seemed like either the workers or management has changed. The service was less friendly and we were rushed to finish our food and clear the tables. It is understandable that the place isn't very big and has a lot of tours eating here, so it is always packed and busy. I probably have a lot of photos from the different times I've eaten here with friends and family. My favorite would be the Japchae and sweet rice drink (Sikhye). The Korean BBQ is a lot more expensive compared to LA, but really good nonetheless. The mackerel and king fish are tasty as well.
author: Joanne H.

description:
Make reservations before coming, really saves you some time! The place isn't so big so the wait can be really long. I never know what to order so i always order the short ribs on the first page which is about $24? I should've taken pictures. 

There are tables where you get to cook yourself and then other tables where you buy it to be cooked. It's nothing like SoCals korean place but this place is nice (food) compared to others.
author: Lily L.

description:
The food here is pretty good. This place seems very popular. 

I enjoyed the seafood pancake and the tofu soup I had here!

Customer service was good.
author: Ann S.

description:
This place has thee best dokbokki!
Or maybe I'm biased but this is the first place I've ever even discovered what dokbokki was! They are soft and chewy and the sauce is super spicy, and better yet, it's a huge portion too!
My friends and I also ordered meat for us to barbeque ourselves right in the center of the table! It was awesome and it made the food worthwhile. We ordered the spicy pork and beef. We also ordered the korean pancake (also one of my favorite korean dishes), japchae (korean noodles), and kimchi bim bim bap. YUUMMMMMM!!!!
There was so much food that we had to take some to-go.
This place is delicious!

But cons include:
- Parking
- Waiting (unless you made reservations)
- Service (sometimes it's only 1 person working)

Other than that, must try!
author: Linda K.

description: DELICIOUS FOOD!! The service is pretty friendly. My waitress answered my questions promptly and patiently. This place is pricey and the portions are EXTREMELY small, however, the food is tasty and authentic! I'm a soup kinda gal, so I always get the spicy tofu soup hot pot! Delicious!!!
author: Cana Y.

description:
I came here for my birthday and was very impressed with the quality of service and food.  This is definitely the best Korean BBQ spot I've been to in San Francisco - I repeat, IN SF!  

You get seated and right away they flood your table with all the side plates.  and it's not just a set per table it's a set per eveery 2 people so there's literally NO SPACE on the table for anything.  SO DELICIOUS!  

If you're looking for somewhere to accommodate large groups of people and ensure that everyone leaves with a full stomach, this is the place to go!  They have a full menu of various meats, vegetables, be bim bap, tofu soups and pancakes.  Everything is very fresh and they give you large portions.  I can remember lots of MMMMMMMMM's and AHHHHHHHH'S from the table as we gorged on all the sides and main plates.  

The service was great!  Every time someone walked by they made sure that the meat was on the grill and that they were distributing everything to any plate that wasn't piled with other items.  Guaranteed a buffet style feast without the ridiculous buffet prices.

My only complaints are they house whole tour buses for lunches/dinners so if you arrive during these times you usually have to wait to be seated and for some reason there's a lot of flies.  Can't they do something about that??
author: Sandy L.

description: I missed their food so much after I moved to peninsula. Finally I'm back to eat again, the food still pretty good very satisfying but the ox tail soup was not too good no tastes even you salt in it. DONT ORDER. Also the service was not too good either me and my husband still eating but they already gave us the check and the sweet drink, ok I think we need to get out of here then.....might not coming back again
author: Michelin Z.

description:
Unlike larger cities, the restaurant selection in SF is limited - and this goes for Korean places too. Of the few possibly worthwhile Korean places in SF, Han Il Kwan is the best. Nice staff, simple dining area, super yummy little dishes, and fair prices. Plus you don't *completely* smell like Korean BBQ when you leave.

I still don't quite understand why Korean tourists would travel to California and then, as a group, patronize a Korean restaurant (I eat McDonalds only when Im alone and cant read the menus) - but that's none of my business. A great place for Korean food in SF.
author: Super F.

description:
The best Korean restaurant I've ever been to. If I can I usually come here with my friends during the lunch special, because the items are really cheap. They will even serve you a FREE dish of tofu soup and a variety of side dishes.

When I go at night I usually go for the Kal Bi Chim and it is absolutely DELICIOUS. I've ordered it every time I've been there and still have not gotten sick of it.

During the night, parking may be harder to find in the area though. Also Friday and Saturday nights are usually the packed nights, and you should expect a wait that MAY range to 40 mins :\ So I suggest going different times for days. The service is known for its slowness, but regardless, I'll give it a 5 stars for the food and will be going back.

And to the people complaining about the stone bibimbap, that is HOW IT IS. It hot in the bottom for the purpose of creating the crispy rice. My friends have ALWAYS enjoyed it for that reason. So don't complain about something you don't know how it's prepared.
author: Harriet W.

description: My FAVORITE korean food place of all time. The taste of food is almost similar to the ones I can have back at home. I'd give the score of 8.5 out of 10. Bibimbaps and dumpling soup and yuk gye jang were all really good. Quantity, Quality satisfied.
author: Heidi L.

description:
There is a tour bus zone in the front and you can park there after 8pm. We waited for the bus to leave so we could park in front of the restaurant after trying to find parking for 30 mins. But wait, some guy from the restaurant runs up and says this public curb is now reserved parking for (preferred) customers. To which I said, where does it say it's reserved? He mumbled something this and that and we just drove away to park elsewhere. 

We walked in and my family was already seated waiting for me and my gf. We had about 10 people and started with 3 plates of bbq (chicken, spicy pork, beef), a tofu soup, and sea food pancake. The waiter goes: you have 10 people you have to order 10 items. we told him we will add more later if we need to. He mumbles something something about not giving 10 bowls of rice and just said you have to order 10 dishes. At this point I've started to raise my voice and basically told him to fck off and put the order in. 

This guy waiter was really something else. We asked him to bring bottles of Hite beers and he brings us warm ones from somewhere instead of the cold ones in the fridge. Knowing how incapable he is, I went to the fridge to change it to the cold ones myself. 

The food was your typical korean bbq. I mean, you can't really screw that up since customers cook their own food right? In the end we added another soup and another beef. But seriously wtf bro waiter, don't tell your customers how to order their food. I'll just stick to the other kbbq places on geary.
author: Roger N.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: Residential parking was really hard to find during dinner time.  So bad that I was 15 minutes late for my reservation.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: The grill fire went out at our table, and it took them about 10 minutes to come over and light it up again.  I think they only had 3 waiters for the who restaurant that had every table full during dinner time. 
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The Korean BBQ is a Must Try!  If you come here and are not sitting at a grill, your missing out.
_____


Overall Experience
3/5 Stars 

_____

Pictures

Restaurant Front: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=V-YkFdYjT8AYTSmtnnnEWw

House Soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=gzKpkoDuVzGUU29jbCongg

Korean BBQ Rib-Eye in Lettuce: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=82x0HKbPesuj3GmPVt_kkg

Korean BBQ Rib-Eye on the Grill Close Up: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=3LFLILEY3gG4ALFCtheFcg

Korean BBQ Rib-Eye on the Grill: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=ThpcAnIZYW0r0esP1mB95Q

Side Dishes: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=0fU-rw-7sQAjVYsAM0n9OQ

Table Grill Fire: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eBxkmr-hJ2KgpZQzEO3ArQ?select=bn0h5SaOpsSWbqfRiPRLHA
author: Elliott N.

description:
When someone told me about a cheap place to eat a full lunch, I wasn't expecting it to be KOREAN BBQ! The lunch menu is quite affordable,ranging from 8-15 dollars, I ordered the beef. As with all Korean BBQ's, we received about 10 side dishes,a bowl of rice,along with a complimentary spicy tofu soup, my favorite! The beef is little bland, but the whole experience dining here was nice. I've come back plenty of times, and will continue too! 

P.S. If your going with a group, each person has to order a dish for the Lunch time.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Fuck this shit. We had a party of five on a Saturday night, so this needs to be prefaced by saying we went at a fairly busy peak hour. However, the service was pathetic and the worst I have ever received dining out. 

We had a member of our party begin waiting in line around 7. The rest of us had come in separate cars so we had to find parking, which was difficult. By the time we had arrived, it was about 7:45 and we were still waiting to be seated. About fifteen minutes later we were seated in the back room at a large table split for two groups. This was just about 8 o'clock. From there we read the menus and settled on what we wanted. 

Here's where the fun begins. Trying to track down a waiter to take our order is like hunting for Nessie in Ireland. We politely requested our order be taken by two separate waiters--one we asked twice--along with the host. Each replied more rudely in return, going so far as to wave us of and yell, "YEAH! YEAH! HOLD ON!!" While we waited for our order to be taken, the waiters brought out food to the tables around us and made MANY trips back and forth to the kitchen. This boggled me; why couldn't they take our orders back with them on one of the many trips back to the kitchen? Our table as well as the table next to ours was right on their route.

To top it all off, about ten minutes after we were seated, another party of three was seated. They were waited on, served and had their food BEFORE we were even given a chance to place our order. They came in AFTER us. 

This restaurant has the WORST customer service I have ever seen. And when my friends and I eat in a group, we are generally more forgiving about wait times. However, we were not going to sit around for over half an hour, be ignored and tip them on top of the already pricey dishes. We ended up leaving at 8:30 to stares and gossip from the waiters. 

Verdict: The staff avoided us like North Korea avoids democracy. They've put me the wrong way. Never again!
author: Larry Y.

description:
Sooo much foood. This is getting five stars for the lunch specials. For dinner it would only get 4 because it's really expensive ($20 for bulgogi) but during lunch it's $10 for the same amount. 

So much banchan (and so tasty). Delicious spicy tofu soup and veg pancakes. The spicy bulgogi and the beef ribs are amazing every time. I'm not Korean, but in my opinion this really is food.

The one thing (that I think might only apply to dinner) is that they bus over loads of people to eat at the restaurant and you can't eat there for like an hour and a half while they're doing this. It seems to happen almost every night, but further validates my opinion that this is legit food.
author: Christine U.

description: Awesome place! They look authentically korean, so it makes the whole experience better. Probably for a couple this restaurant is not a good idea since they serve a lot of free appetizers, so leave this place for groups hangouts. The servers are very reserved and barely talk to you. That's always a minus. But overall good food, good experience.
author: Celinés V.

description: This is an amazing Korean restaurant. They manage to cater to the locals and bus loads of others pretty seamlessly. They have excellent food and service.  I will definitely be back again and again. Thanks.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Very good and service... Love the bim bam seafood.... And the appetizers.... Definitely this will be my Korean to go Resto.
author: Paul T.

description:
.. WOW!! 
That was my reaction after leaving Han II Kwan. This Richmond-hidden Korean Lunch Special really blew me away. Forget the life story, I'm just gonna get straight to the point. 

My girlfriend and I came here at 3PM, in hopes that we could get some affordable Korean eats (cause we all know Korean food don't come cheap), and to our surprise, they were still serving their lunch specials (till 4PM!). Also, keep in mind that we ONLY ordered 2 items (which would be the meat entrees).

Korean Pancake: [http://s3yelp2-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/00Cq0CwvXCRgPDrvDFW8oQ/l.jpg] 
When they placed this on our table, we thought they mixed up our order, but in fact, it was "fer freeeee!" (I'm assuming this was part of the incoming Banchan) Anyways, it was good -- a corn like cake which required the dipping sauce for taste. 

Spicy Tofu Soup: [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/hpF8fUdNI-NRJtIRBU1FAA/l.jpg]
This is one of two complimentary choices you'll receive from the lunch special (steamed egg is the second choice). It was a very authentic and hearty AND SPICY kimchi flavored tofu soup. Really warmed me up on a foggy Richmond afternoon.

Banchan : [http://s3yelp4-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/lFXmHqcQPjuXlMKZ_1jWlQ/l.jpg]
7 Banchans in total and all of them were fresh. However, I was a little disappointed on their take of kimchi because I like mine DRENCHED in kimchi chili sauce. I can't complain because at this point, I was already getting full..

Marinated Rib Eye Beef: $9.95 [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/K3Nk2M5TbXJ2xxhM2qlEcg/l.jpg]
This was a lot of meat (and there was still another plate coming). However, quantity doesn't mean quality. The beef was good, but was slightly overcooked, which also means that it's dry.. Will be sure to ask for medium rare next time.

Spicy Pork BBQ: $7.95 [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/1t0pu15-WBZi-OipQ4N5EQ/l.jpg]
This was my favorite dish. It was the first thing that caught my eye on the menu and I'm glad I ordered it. The pork was very nicely seasoned, SPICY as intended, and very soft and tender. And again, large portions for just a lunch special. Even though I was stuffed, I HAD to finish it ALL!

What's a Korean meal without everybody's favorite rice drink for dessert? [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/NnVCOlBF8V4PzQWMeEV2tg/l.jpg]


Overall, the service was amazingly fast! We walked in, picked a window seat, ordered within 5 minutes, and within minutes, one by one, the food kept coming in! The employees were also very nice and courtesy. We even asked for hot sauce and, instead of a small dipping place of sauce, they gave us the whole damn bottom! Furthermore, the food was great, with the small misses.

Best part yet -- a huge Korean feast for two; totaled to ONLY $19.42!! [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/EjmLBkNPD6iYAxZ3ontsBg/l.jpg]
author: Albert L.

description: Super yummy Korean food!! They're almost always busy so the food can take a little longer than average, but the wait is worth it, and the staff are really friendly.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Great Korean food! I come here when I want some real Korean food. I've had their duk gook, pa-jon, kalbi, and soon du boo! All really good.  The Panchan is really generous which is why it gets a 5 star in my book!! 

Would highly recommend!
author: R K.

description: The brisket was absolutely delicious. and those seafood pancakes were great. A bit of a different mix of kimchi than I'm used to, but tasted really great. The service was nice and quick, too.
author: Charles G.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place - on one hand, the food is great. On the other hand, I've never received SUCH shitty service at a KBBQ restaurant. It was straight up terrible. More on that later.

My boyfriend and I came hungry as hell and so stoked to have some great KBBQ in SF (a rarity!) - we ordered the marinated short ribs and the pork belly, our two favorite things to order at KBBQ joints. The pork belly was thick and juicy; it hit my craving soooo nicely! My boyfriend loved the kalbi as well. It's not quite as good as some places we like in LA but it's the big bone kind which is delicious. They give you a wide array of tasty banchans, lettuce, rice, and soft tofu soup with your order. No shortage of food, to say the least.

What really killed the whole experience for me was the awful service. They were so cold and borderline rude, as if they just wanted us to eat and get out. We had to wave excessively to get anyone's attention and when we did they would ignore us. When they did manage to do things, they did it with attitude. We tried to be friendly and nice and they really didn't reciprocate any warmth, acting like we were a huge nuisance to be eating at their restaurant. Maybe it was just an off day, but I'm used to KBBQ places being super friendly and cheery, not like they want you to get out.. When they changed the grill there was still soap on it, and when we wiped it off, the napkin was almost completely blackened with the dirt. Also wouldn't let us take food home. What? I paid for a set amount and didn't get to enjoy all of it.

Anywho. 4 stars for food, 2 for service, so 3 overall. It was pricey - after tax and tip I paid $63 for kalbi and pork belly. Good but I wouldn't come again because.of the awful customer service.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
I love coming here for some authentic Korean food. I've come here a few times and tried something different each time. The service can be spotty sometimes, but the staff is nice. 

They always provide tons of side dishes, which keeps me occupied until the entrees come. You also get a choice of steamed egg or tofu soup with your meal. Both are good, but definitely get the tofu soup. My friends and I finally remembered to actually choose to get that rather than having them pick for us. 

The seafood bibimbap is absolutely delicious, different from anywhere else I've tried. 

For the Korean BBQ, we tried the marinated chicken and bulgogi. It was enough for 5 of us considering we ha bowls of rice, dukboki, kimchee pancake, along with all the side dishes.

You definitely need to give this place a try.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I was visiting up from Los Angeles and someone was craving Korean food so we ended up at Han Il Kwan. San Francisco isn't known for it's Korean food but I guess I"m just spoiled by having the best Korean restaurants possibly in all of California in Los Angeles.

This place was just average if not below it on some of the dishes. The kimchee pancake was actually really bad, but the galbee beef was OK. There was a bland set of flavors in some of the jigae we got.  Things just didn't seem all that fresh and bland. It did the job but it wasn't anything special.The Korean BBQ fast food place we have in a food court here is better than this restaurant. Oh well. If you're craving, it will satisfy.
author: John S.

description: This is my favorite Korean place in the city. You get a variety of side dishes, cook on the table, generous portions. I have been going here for over 20 years. Truly authentic.
author: East Bay Mom L.

description: I've been here twice now and both times I have not been disappointed with the food, although the service is a bit spotty at times. I've had the seafood pancake, galbi, spicy pork, and jap chae- I would recommend any and all that I've tried so far. I absolutely love the ban-chan here as well as the free bowl of sundubu or steamed egg- the complimentary sides are the best I've ever had, hands down! Give this place a try, it's stood out to me as a good spot for Korean even though I've tried other popular spots in Richmond.
author: Frank U.

description: Ive been here a dozen times at least as its my favorite place for korean food in the bay area. All the familiar dishes (bbq, tofu soup, seafood pajun) are excellent but my absolute favorite thing here is the kalbi jjim = stewed short rib. If you've never had it before you have seriously been missing out. Price is warranted because its a big dish you share.  You'll impress your friends and thank me later. I'm hungry just thinking about it now.
author: Huy V.

description: Don't get me wrong the food is great. But waiting for an hour with empty tables and feeding tour bus person after your bus person for an hour. I'm looking for another Korean resturant
author: Parker S.

description:
My favorite Korean restaurant in the city! 

Pros:
Nice place, fancy
Tons of sides!
DELICIOUS FOOD
Big portions
Good service

Cons:
Slightly pricy
author: Christina G.

description:
Great Korean place!

I came here today at around 11 am (right when they opened) with a friend. We were immediately seated with our menus.

I ordered a bibimbap and my friend ordered the spicy pork; both were good! One thing I really like about Han Il Kwan is that they always give you something complimentary. This time, I got two mini, complimentary pancakes (delicious) and a small stone bowl of tofu soup (delicious as well). 

They also gave us a wide variety of ban chans; I usually have to ask the server to refill my banchans but not at Han Il Kwan! 

The lunch specials are reasonable for the amount of food they give. Lastly, we got a little, cold rice drink that was sweet. Yum! 

I definitely will be coming back!

*There was a sign outside the restaurant that said starting (i forgot the month), they are closed on Wednesdays.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying I am in no way a Korean food expert, and I was the only whitey in this joint.
