The egg in a bowl that they said was on the house was also similarly burnt.  The Beef was also not as tasty as before and the amount was definitely not enough for even one person.

Needless to say I won't be coming back here again. I rather drive down to Sunnyvale for their superior Korean restaurants.
author: Vincent P.

description: Awesome Korean BBQ!  Great selection, authentic spices, and friendly service.  Go early or be willing to wait if you want a table with a BBQ built-in.
author: Steve J.

description:
Okay, so this is my second time coming here. Sadly I will not come back here again.  Mainly because of a communication error that the restaurant made, and also because other places have better food than Han Il Kwan.  If you want to read the whole story then it's below.

It all started when I called at noon to see if they could accomodate a group of 10.  Person on the phone said yes and asked whether I wanted a regular table or a bbq table.  I told her the bbq table and she confirmed.  Later that evening, I called again to tell the restaurant that our party of 10 for the bbq table would be 20 minutes late.  The person who I spoke with told me it was okay.  Alright so when we arrived we were seated quite promtly.  They brought us in the back room and let us order.  I told them I was getting a couple orders of meat to bbq (here's where it starts going wrong) and the waiter told me that bbq was not available in the room because the air duct was not in service.  I told him I confirmed a bbq table for 10 and he told me that I called in and told them a party of 7 and later called in (when I called in to tell them we'd be late) and changed it to a party of 10...so they could do 7 outside to bbq but not 10.

I was pretty angry then because of the error the restaurant made.  A couple of people haven't tried table bbq before and the main purpose was to let them try it.  At this time I was thinking "Shit, I should've went to Brothers, why the hell did I choose this place"  So okay...it's a hassle to leave now, so I just order.  I get 3 meat dishes and ask if tha't enough meat for everyone then the wait says, oh you need to order 10 things minimum in the room.  I'm thinking what the hell....first you trick me into thinking you could accommodate a party of 10 for bbq, then you stick me in a room where you can't bbq,now you tell me because I was forcefully stuck in the room that I have to order 10 things minimum. I went ahead and ordered and the waiter cut me a break with the 10 item minimum and probably saved me from having an aneurysm on the spot.

Needless to say, the dinner wasn't anything impressive.  The side dishes were at most just okay, everyone thought the bulgoki and the chicken was too dry and the portions of the kimchee pancake was too small.  I should have just went to brothers or wooden bbq.  I would have even drove to Choi's Family if I knew what was going to happen.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: MMMM this place is so yummy! I love the thick pork and the snacks (Pon Chon?) Koreans really have amazing food. I'll return for sure!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Hands down, one of the best Korean restaurants in the city.  My Korean gal pal selected this restaurant for a girl's night out, Korean style, and she admitted that this place is much better than the popular Brothers restaurant.  The portions are large and tasty.  I was with a group of 7 women and there were actual moments of silence because everyone was busy eating - not common when you get together seven women with the gift to gab!
author: michele g.

description: I parked about a block away and as we walked closer, the smell of BBQ started to get stronger and stronger. I wondered how the neighbors feel about smelling korean bbq all day and night haha... We come here in large numbers, usually for birthday dinners and such so they always give us the "expandable" rooms in the back (accomplished via folding hard curtains to separate rooms) The spicy pork is to die for here as well as the kal bi. We used to "cook it ourselves" when we were young.. but since were older now, it takes longer to grow back singed eyebrows and arm hair.. not to mention that the guys got tired of coming by with squirt bottles extinguishing our flames haha.. cool place to go.. good eats.. word of advice.. don't go clubbin after because your gonna smell like chef Kim Jong-Il.
author: Alan N.

description: Busloads of Korean tourists are unloaded here all the time so we thought this must be da bomb! But my high expectations fizzled out as soon as we tasted the spicy tofu soup. It seemed diluted and tasteless. The daeji bulgogi was just average. The only thing that I was happy with were the small bountiful appetizers and the quick and friendly service. They also gave a complimentary stone bowl steamed egg - kinda like Chawanmushi. In any case, it wasnt a truly satisfying korean dinner and I would rather go to tofu house which is cheaper and taste better!
author: Topazskye L.

description: I try this place out because my friends wanted to. the sides are decent could be better. although, i was not a big fan of their kal bi or bu go gi. the service is good but not my type of usual korean dining place.
author: Ann L.

description:
3.25
pretty authentic place. we ordered two orders of bbq ribs but it was either very small or they messed up.  they told us they combined the orders but i was skeptical. I would try ordering different dishes to avoid this problem i guess. other than that mishap, i would recommend this place. Parking was nearly impossible to find and the waiting times can be long since theres only about 7 grills. Overall this place cant complete with socal korean bbq places but its decent enough to warrant consideration when craving korean food
author: Robert Y.

description: What can I say about this place- a neighborhood gem.  The service is great, they come by and help you cut up the meat, grill it for you and bring you lots it refills for side dishes.  Price is right and the food is good.  I love the spicy rice cake with fish cake...its delicious.  Of course the BBQ is very good, especially the beef short ribs.  It is out of my way (I am lazy getting out of my hood), but for this, I will drive across town for a cozy dinner with my friends.
author: Wendy C.

description: The side dishes they serve here are great, especially the one I had before with squid. I wish they have better menu selection of hot pot dishes since I often fine by myself, but the ones I've ordered here so far are good.  The one thing to be aware of is the fact that there will be busloads of Korean tourists coming here for a meal, occupying much space therefore making a longer wait for a table at times.
author: H K.

description:
Celebrated my birthday there with 30 of my closest friends!  They gave us our own room which was great because we were able to laugh, talk and drink without anyone complaining!  I think we ordered 20 bottles of shoju!  

Food was excellent as always, but the portions are a bit small.  I guess that's what keeps you coming back for more huh?  Plus, the price is reasonable, so I can't complain.  The tab came to about $850 for 30 people...not bad at all.  

Good times!
author: susie b.

description: I think this is my favorite Korean restaurant in the city. You get the option to bbq at the table or have them cook it for you. They give you tons of banchan and complimentary dishes. Free food is always good! I just wish they would hire a few more people. Its like the mom, dad, and son taking orders, busing, and serving the entire restaurant.  If you come in a large group and they sit you in the private rooms--good luck! The service is REALLY slow but when the food comes out--they ALL come out. Try not to fill yourself up on the banchan while waiting for your entrees. it's also a b!tch to get their attention for water, napkins, more drinks, to order...you get the point. You complain and complain about the wait but at the end of your meal--you'll definitely be satisfied so tough it out  or come with less people :)
author: Kim D.

description: Food is 3 1/2 stars for Korean, 4 stars relative to your average all-comers restaurants, and 4 stars for friendly, accommodating, generous service.  Decent overall renditions of Korean standbys, good panchan, and some unexpected items as well.  A solid bet if you're in the neighborhood (bonus: real close to Golden Gate Park!).
author: Nate S.

description:
i have visited this restaurant with friends several times now and simply love it. even with the tour buses we didn't have to wait long for a table.

the meat is marinated very nicely and decent portions. good selection of side dishes. we also chose the steamed egg which was tasty.

the only down side to this place is parking. expect to drive around and around the area searching for a parking spot. i think each time we came it took upward of 20 mins or more to find one. you might also have to park several blocks away and walk back to the restaurant, however it's worth the effort.
author: Hanna J.

description:
SERVICE: Not very friendly and slow. They won't seat you at a BBQ table if it is bigger than what you need. 
AMBIANCE: Causal, medium sized restaurant, can fit several big parties at a time.
PARKING: Difficult
REVIEW:
We order BBQ at the table option. You must have a minimum of 2 orders. I don't advise BBQ at the table for parties less than 3 table. Just too much food. You get lots of meat, lettuce, side dishes, rice and soup. The food was quite good. The meat was tender and flavorful. There was lots of side dish, my fav that they gave me: pickled octopus? 
I actually do like this place but the wait was a big no no especially since they had the tables. I understand that they didn't want us to crowd a table bigger than what we needed, but no one even use those tables the whole time we were there. They should really just sit everyone so they can have a fast table turn over rate. They lost customers when we were there.
author: Jess H.

description: We go here often but last night we ordered the beef and chicken cooked.  Both were not as tastly as normal.  The side dishes still taste great though!  The beef was extremely dry and tasteless, i bet it was sitting in the kitchen for awhile before we got there.  This place is normally very good but for some odd reason the food was not the same last night.  Parking is very hard to find.  But all in all, it is a very good Korean BBQ resturant.
author: jason c.

description: I heart this place. The side dishes are delish and so is the bul go ki. Definitely clean and you don't smell like Korean food for days.
author: Beth W.

description:
Love this place!

Pros: 

   - Great side dishes, which are refilled, and free steamed egg!
   - Selections are very tasty, large portions.
   - Price is not expensive, and considering the amount of food, very decent.
   - Great service, lively atmosphere and interior.
   - And I haven't even tried the meat, which everyone else loves.

Cons:
  - You will get the very occasional hair.
  - Everything we had was fantastic, except the mackerel, which was a bit too crispy.


Anyway, this is my favorite place to go to! 5 stars!
author: Al L.

description:
We went there tonight for the first time, and the bbq was good eventhough I prefer the actual charcoal grills as opposed to the gas grilled meats.  The bright side is you don't leave smelling like your dinner for the rest of the night. The ventilation system is adequate which I can say is not true of all bbq places.
The service is very good, they cut and cook all your meat, replace your side dishes, and they are friendly.  The spicy pork was better than the kalbi and the tofu soup that was "on the house" was definately not that flavorful.  
It is true that tour buses drop off diners who inhale food for about thirty minutes before heading back onto their buses. Whether that means this is more authentic or tradtional korean food, I have no idea.
author: J. S.

description:
Nice place to dine...where did that fine ass Korean waitress go? Dang! LOL!
 
We usually order the shrimp, spicy beef and pork dishes to cook on the grill! You all gotta try the Jap Che, that's such a great  noodle dish! Good stuff!! 

Lots of tasty side dishes they give. I would say a dozen of em'! Oh yah, they have that great spicy soup as well! Nice!!

For dessert we had what I called sink water rice and sugar...not pretty, but good!!

The waitresses are very friendly and polite. Parking is not that great though. Lots of Korean tourists come in their big tour bus, so don't be surprised to see this place packed!
author: Marc E.

description: Came here again and called in advance for the charcoal...food tasted so much better with the charcoal infusion, but man is is hot....i think I'll leave that work to the skilled BBQ chefs and stick with the usual setup cuz I was sweating like a whore in church.
author: Stacy T.

description:
i have not tried this place yet but have attempted to come here twice, once for dinner last night, I couldnt even get a table for 3 people!! It was only a Monday and at 6pm!!!  I walked in, asked for a table for 3, looked around to see many many tables available....the waiter was about to seat me but another person said something in Korean, the waiter then told me they are fully booked with reservations.  2nd, I tried calling today for a reservation for lunch time, 1pm..."sorry, we have a big group coming in and we will be very very busy"...OMFG...seriously, a table for 2 people would be too busy,  what's the point when I cant even call in ahead of time to get a table for 2 people??? they mind as well close off this restaurant and make it for TOURIST ONLY!  he said you can try to come in at 1 and see if we have any tables available...if you only have an hour lunch, why would you wanna do that?? I asked him, can I call a bit before 1pm to see if you have any tables? "No, we can't do that", oh and i forgot to mention, he said this to me at the end "we don't make same day reservations".....ridiculous...this place is not even an high end korean fancy ass rest....

Update....so I finally got a table today by walking in! Yay, did I hit the jackpot? Anyway, my friend and I came here for lunch today, friend walked in first and this waiter totally ignored her while another waiter greeted her and sat her to a corner table. I honestly have to say that the food here is not bad. I'll give it 2 more stars just for the food...so a total of 3 stars for food. Service was AWFULL!!!!!!!  The guy wearing white today looks like he swallowed a rat, his face scrunged up like an old prune when we asked for boxes to box our left overs. BAD bad service
author: Alyce l.

description:
Good korean food fix for the traveler.
Friendly service.
No parking.  Circled around for 15 minutes to park on geary.
Soup and jigaes are good.
Bibimbap was average.
Large portions and reasonably priced.

Unfortunately, we've been spoiled by the korean food in Los Angeles and Seoul, Korea.
author: Jerry L.

description: No parking around. Food is blah, not much flavor to the beef or the soup we ordered. The nice thing is all the side dishes it comes with. The women waitress have no people skills so this is why they have the nice guy in the front who is friendly and helpful.
author: Nia N.

description: Super yummy restaurant. Everything was really good. We ordered a family style meal with about 10 dishes. I went with about 6 of my girlfriends and we couldn't finish all the food! It was too much! My favorite dishes were kimchi pancakes, kalbi, jap chae (korean noodles), and all the sides! mMmmm... However, it was a tad on the pricier side...that was the only downside of it.
author: Sharon G.

description: Huge restaurant to accommodate large groups considering you'll always see tour bus dining here.  AGAIN, they COOK the food for you and me no likey :( Their marination was nothing special. Cheap eats for 15 people under $300 with tips and we ordered a lot!
author: Katy N.

description:
First of all i want to  thank you for all the free stuff, the MUNG BEAN CAKE and the DESSERT DRINK!  Ambiance is very nice and cool. It's a pretty neat place to eat! Can accomodate big groups of people. The service was excellent, the staff was very welcoming and attentive! We didn't order any appetizer since we all know that Korean restaurants always usually  serve KIMCHI before the main course. But, i was surprised because not only we had a KIMCHI but they serve us BANCHAN- (8 sml plates of different kinds of appetizer!) They are so tasty! love the one with the fish, squid, and the cucumber! Also, we ordered 1.)  BIBIMBOP- which we all love bec of the crispy rice on the bottom of the pot. 2.) STEAM EGG Soup- my favorite! very light and not too salty.. delectable!  3.) MONGOLIAN BEEF- tender and savory. 4.)TOFU SOUP- too watery for me but, it was ok. and lastly we ordered some KIMCHI PANCAKE- not a fan, sorry!
For seven ppol we ended up paying a total of $90.  Not too bad!
author: Rowen F.

description: parking in this hood is a bizatch!  However, once you start your meal, you will quickly forget how many times you circled around for a parking space.  This joint has the best korean bbq! Word! The kal bi, spicy pork, tripe...its all good!  But no matter what, don't forget to order the beef rib stew!
author: Peter M.

description: The food here is really delicious.  The meat is fresh and really lean, and their very generous about the little dishes of extras.  The service is a lot better than Brother's on Geary, which is a big plus for me.  It's also a lot more mellow with less people and less waiting.  Mmmmm...good!
author: Kristina R.

description: So the food is good, love the kimchi! Great service for an asian restaurant, but its always been slow when I've been here. Prices are a tad on the high side. But if you come during their lunch happy hour they have great deals! Love the bibimbap!!!!! Way out of my way though to get here which sucks. But as long as I keep getting a ride, I'll keep coming back!
author: Megan L.

description: I came here with a friend and we ordered the Bulgogi and Chicken. Skeptic of how little the food might be (since we love eating!), we ordered an extra side dish of Jap Chae noodles on the side. After ordering I went to wash my hands and when I came back- holy sh!t !!! Never have I seen so many side dishes before!!! Wow! There must have been like 10 little dishes surrounding our grill. Plus we got rice and soup too. The downside, however, was the quality of the food. The meat did not appear to be that fresh and the side dishes were not that good. For almost the same price, I can get melt in your mouth meat elsewhere.
author: Kim N.

description: The food is pretty good, a little too oily to my liking. I ordered the bibimbap, I'd say it's above average but too heavy and oily. The side dishes are very good, especially the spicy tofu stew! I would've given this place 4 star, except for the fact that the parking there is impossible!! And the barbecue smell was too strong so you'd come out smell heavily like korean food. The place is also busy so service wasn't sufficient. Overall good meal with somewhat lacking experience.
author: Katherine L.

description: Great food, waiter and waitress gives attitude.
author: Lovetea C.

description: I've tried multiple Korean restaurants in SF and this one is the best. They give you all the little side dishes which always are fresh. The service is fast and friendly.  My favorite is the complimentary tofu soup and the BBQ Pork.  I took a star off because sometimes the do over cook the pork, the flavor is still right on.  I would definitely recommend this place for authentic Korean.
author: Michele G.

description:
i think this place is fabulous.  the food is really good, their ban-chan is tasty and you can tell a place by the ban-chan.  it shows detail and care for the flavors.  

i have tried their ahl-jee-gea, ox-tail soup, dol-sot-bibim-bap, and a variety of other dishes and all have been really good.  whenever i order something that is not a soup or stew dish they always give me soon- doo-boo as the service dish and that is a main dish on its own.  

when they bring you your side dish and that pancake thing (kong-beejee) comes with, its a good place.  especially if it good, which this place is tasty.  it looks so simple to make but a lot of work goes into it.  thats how you can tell they really take pride in their food.  

there are only two possilby bad things i can say about this place.....the server who works there i think everyday is usually alone unless they know they are having a huge tour crowd come by.  she's so nice and tries to attend to all so well.  the other is........i don't remember.  i guess only one bad thing.  oh wait....i remember........its a little pricey but i'd pay more for good food.

if you like korean food  go hear and be nice to the lady when she's alone =)
author: junie k.

description: One of my favorite Korean resturant in SF. The food is good and service is wonderful. The only bad thing is parking, sometimes you have to look for parking for at least 30min.
author: Matthew k.

description: Lunch time with My GF after a long hard work from sfsu, We decided to try this restaurant. We were initially gonna go to Tofu House, because that place was pretty good, but my goodness... THIS place is the shit.. at first their hosting kinda because we were kind of ignored even though the server saw us.. also, I saw one of the customers just seat themselves after waiting for what seemed like about 6 to 7 minutes.. (mind you, there were plenty seats) anyways... I normally consume about 3 to 4000 calories... EASY in any given restaurant.. but these guys had so much food, that I was so stuffed.... it made me so happy.. I finally found a restaurant that filled me up so much to the point I did not want to move.. I still finished it.. I ordered the casserole soup and pork bulgogi.. and a complimentary steamed egg.. and like about 10 side dishes.. the casserole was amazing.. bulgogi,.. i'll say about 8 out of 10.. the price.. was very similar to other korean restaurants.. but there was so much food compared to other places.. that I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this place to anyone.. MInd you, I am korean.. and I've had pretty  good korean foods throughout my life.. this place definetely did its justice.. and It was also lovely because while there wasnt much parking, there werent many cars roaming around so No pressure trying to parallel park while 5 million people are waiting behind you!!!!!.. WONDER fking FUL place
author: Sean P.

description:
After reading all the rave reviews, I had to try this place out. When I got there, they were a bit busy (730p on a sunday). I was by myself, the server just told me there was no place for me to sit. There were 3 empty tables. I realize I was by myself, but this was not a very satisfying response from the server. She basically told me I could not eat there, regardless of how long I waited. I left and ate somewhere else. 

For some reason, I decided to give them a second chance. This time I actually got seated and ordered up some dolsitt bi bim bap. After finishing the bowl I wondered - am I in the right place? It was OK, but with the overwhelmingly positive reviews one expects a little better. 

Don't go out of your way for this place.
author: paul l.

description: Not my favorite Korean restaurant in the city, but it is just decent. They do give you good portions and the price is about right. However, the food isn't very tasty, not spicy enough in my own words, and the tofu soup doesn't have much flavor. I probably won't come here again if I am craving for goood Korean food. It will for sure be the one by Jtown. Their service is decent, it is a bit busy so the workers tend to ignore you a little bit. Good to have different restaurant experience tho.
author: Sandy L.

description: very typical korean joint in the city, lots of banchan(side dishes), and the usual offerings on their menu. friend and i ordered their tofu soup and seafood/scallion pancakes. the tofu soup was good, but not as hearty and flavorful as my tofu house. pancakes were fluffy, but more on the mushy side. i like my foods with a crunch. i do like the spaciousness of the dining area. overall, a winning dinner on the tuesday night.
author: Melissa Y.

description: decent kalbi...pretty good dwe-gee-bulgogi (spicy pork)...the spicy octopus was lacking in well...octopus...the free tofu stew was XL which was a nice touch....it was okay service...but not the best i've seen....the banchan (side-dishes) were everflowing and always full....overall..i would give this place 3.5...close to 4....but i felt the service was just slightly lacking....but decent..korean pancake service was also a nice touch....and very tasty...but ah...maybe couple more tries...and i'll see if this place can persuade me to 4 stars...
author: Hen A.

description:
this place has very good ban chan! the dishes are so full compared to some other places ive been. the same lady is always there when i go for lunch. their lunch specials are so worth the money. you get so much for around $8. their dol sot bibimbap is so good! i want some now. yum. however, sometimes the kalbi is not as hot and sizzling as other times. 

i went there for dinner the first time about 2-3 months ago. i never went there for dinner bc it looks expensive. but i went with a party of 9 and we got so much food for $16 a person! and thats tip included! everyone went home full and happy and a bunch of leftovers!
author: L M.

description: Pretty good dol sot bibimbab and side dishes. The barbecue smelled really good. But parking sucks and the place is always really busy so service is a little lacking.
author: Leiwen W.

description:
Three stars for the food, one star for a very poor service. The waiter is not very kind nor serviceable.
Overall average Korean BBQ place, with gas BBQ. It is still reasonably good and tasty, the best is really the well separated tables with fixed walls in between which help making the atmosphere and the dinner more intimate and enjoyable.
author: Cedrick C.

description: If you can go on weekday at lunch, they have awesome lunch specials under $10. Han Il Kwan gives you so much food - all the little side dishes, tofu soup, seafood pancake, and shik hye for dessert. Hello! Who else does that?
author: Fanny S.

description:
Yummy Korean cuisine.  Kim chee on the side.

I enjoy eating at Han IL Kwan.  I was introduced to this restaurant in October 2009 when our tai chi class celebrated our master's birthday.  The food was delicious and not hot and spicy.   I have been back numerous times. 

The waiters and waitresses were efficient, courteous and did not rushed our meal.

The place is always packed even on a Monday evening. (Korean tourist on bus tours).  

Please make reservations ahead of time.




\
author: Ann O.

description:
we decided that the next time we eat out it would be korean.  we have our normal cuisines and go to restos, so we've made a pact and concious effort to try new and different things.  my new love and addition to my diet , seafood, has also opened many horizons of places where we can both enjoy dishes.

that being said, we were in the richmond as he had to price a job, and we knew that there were many korean spots to venture to.  this particular one seemed to get many reviews on yelp, and funny enough the job he went to was directly across the street from here -- destiny.

i ordered the seafood bi bim bap.  him being more adventurous in food, had the tripe and intestine soup; definitely not for the faint-hearted.  we were surprised to see all the little side dishes.  we first received the mung bean and potato pancakes, and were delighted with them.  we were shocked when we received about 8-9 additional sides.  we weren't too sure what was going on, and we knew we didn't order them.  we thought that it might be a pay-as-you-go deal where they would charge you per side you ate.  we figured we'd take on the questionable bill at the end, and eat the sides -- they were too tasty looking to resist.  i was pretty stuffed, to say the least, by the time our entrees came.  i enjoyed my bi bim bap to the max, and he rated his soup 4 out of 5 stars.  he said it had an earthy flavor to it.  my dish came out sizzling, and was delicious with a smokey flavor to it.

at the end i had a to-go carton filled to the brim in a doggie bag.  they even gave us a sweet rice drink for dessert.  we were bracing ourselves for the bill.  low and behold, we were charged for only what we ordered.  it was wonderful!  my experience with korean restaurants have only been to cheap bbq joints as a child, and during lunch in the recent years.  we were both neophytes to their traditional way of serving dinner..

grills are at some of the booths where you can cook up a storm and order your meat of choice.  

my only gripe about the place was the lack of explanation...  we were both clueless with all the free food being served to us.  while it was great to have someone bring side after side dish to the table, we were confused.  when asked about each dish, the male server answered in a tone where he looked down upon us, and seemed frustrated that we did not understand the culture and orientation of their style of dinner.  he knew we were puzzled by the looks on our faces, as all these sides that we didn't order kept being served, and i feel he could have approached our ignorance and numerous questions in a kinder manner.

i'm all about the free food, especially food that taste good, and despite the above mentioned waiter's attitude, we both will be back!
author: Sheri N.

description: This is definitely one of the better Korean places to eat in the city.  The korean bbq and sindabu are very good.  This is probably the only Korean place I've been to that actually served the sweet rice water soup for dessert.  I would recommend eating here if you live or are visiting the area.  I will hit this place up again when I move closer.
author: Fatty A.

description:
my 2 year old boy and i come here for lunch almost every week and he eats almost everything.  

food is really good and they have a bathroom with an area for me to change my boy's diaper in (that's a huge plus in any restaurant).  if you're not familiar with k-food, this is the best place to experience it.  it's also good for big groups.  

price is reasonable and location is good, too.  service is a little slow at times but what's the rush when you've got all those yummy banchan (side dishes) before the main entree?
author: Jane R.

description: I was tricked into this place being a mellow resturant with dim lights reflecting off firm colored wood. The atmosphere in here resembles that of a hot pot resturant: Unimpressive. The few standard korean resturant appitizers they served were cold and bland. Luckily I ordered the squid. This was the only highlight of the night. It was a slightly spicy and carried alot of sauce. The texture came to be chewy and cruchy to the mouth. Service, however, was a strong suit of the resturant. Food came promptly. The waitress was extremely polite. And the setting of a the resturant looks like it can support a huge crowd yet still welcoming of dining for two. Overall, it's a good resturant. I was just expecting a smaller homier feel from window shopping.
author: Harry L.

description: I came here with my family based on good reviews but was severely disappointed. The service here was absolutely terrible. First, we waited at least 20 minutes before we got seated, which is quite ridiculous considering there were plenty of open tables. When we were ordering, the waitress told us we needed to order more food. We ordered the minimum 2 plates because we weren't that hungry. She told us we need to order more since we have 4 people. We asked her if there was a minimum based on the amount of people seated and she said no. So, we didn't order more (we ordered $50 worth of food already) and we later saw her gossiping about us with her coworkers. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL! They even had the nerve to point and glare at us! In addition to this, the flame on our grill kept going out and they ignored us as we tried to get their attention.When they finally came, they made it seem like it was a hassle to come over. They didn't even come to refill our tea or side dishes once. The cooking surface was covered in debris and they were too lazy to brush it off. The flame never came back on. We were so irritated that we boxed up the still rare meat, deciding to just cook it at home. Keep in mind, we only ordered two small plates of meat. And to make the experience even worse, the food here was below average. It's overpriced and the kal-bi was not marinated enough. Barely had any flavor. Want good and cheap korean food? Go to My Tofu House.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The best Korean restaurant in SF so far, and I even thought the experience/satisfaction was better than Brothers. I'm from Korea, and I always thought that to get good Korean food you have to go down to South Bay if you live in SF. But this place proved me wrong. My friends and I could smell the BBQ of this place on the way to here on a hungry Saturday night. I'm pretty sure we'll head back there again sometime very, very soon.

Pros:
-Lots of menu options, so you can bring your vegetarian friends too. They eagerly left out the meat gladly when we asked for it.
-BBQ meat were large in portion than I thought - enough for two people per order. Unless you're a meat lover and decided to fill yourself up with pounds and pounds of meat.
-Few special side dishes were on the house. Maybe because we filled a big table with a pretty big order for 5 people. 
-Other regular side dishes were tasty too. Kimchi was on the more anchovy-side (Kimchi is usually made and seasoned with anchovy paste for saltiness and flavor), which I like, but some of my non-Korean friends weren't a fan. We didn't need to ask for refills because we ordered so much food we barely finished the main items. But I have no doubt that they will be more than eager to do so.
-When asked for the grill plate change, it was done promptly. Again, this could be because the place wasn't that crowded at 10pm on Saturday. (FYI: if you get any kind of meat with thick marinade, such as spicy beef or pork, it'll probably char up the grill quickly. Koreans usually grill the meat separately on different parts of the grill, or grill lightly marinated meat first and then move on to thick marinade.)
-Complimentary shot of Korean dessert drink, Shik Hae (Sheek-Hey). Used to be my favorite traditional dessert when I was growing up. It's cream-colored, sugary, and has traces of rice grains in it. Think of white beer with some natural sediments, only white instead of yellow.

Cons:
-Sort of secluded from other restaurants and stores in the area, although I don't know if it's a real con.
-Some servers might appear more clumsy and less attentive and friendly. But I think it's just their personality.
author: Inbae L.

description: OK - I'm giving 5 stars because this restaurant beats any other Korean restaurants that I've been to, thus far. I've been very disappointed with Korean restaurants in SF in general until I came here. Granted, I've been to far better ones, but this is a place I will go to if I'm in the mood for Korean BBQ in the city. The galbi is nicely seasoned, tender, and not too "fatty"; however, the belly pork isn't anything spectacular and not that it was bad - i wouldn't care to order it again. The freshness of the side dishes is above average - and a huge plus for me is that they are not cheap on side dishes - they exceed 3-4 and a great variety! Also this goes well with Hite beer...(light and crisp!)
author: Audrey L.

description:
i like this korean restaurant because of the ventilation. 

after you eat the wonderfully crispy mung-bean cakes, bulgogi (meh - i like it with more bbq flavor), the panchan (great selection) the steamed egg pudding (refreshing) and some of the best kim chi chige (tofu soup) in the city, you aren't wearing that smell the rest of the day. or at least until you start making kimchee burps. 

me rikee.
author: Winter R.

description: Good food, good service, more importantly good Korean BBQ! They have delicious side dishes and the Kalibi is freakin delicious! Definitely would recommend this place for anyone craving Korean BBQ!
author: Kelly N.

description: Their food was quite tasty. We got a dol sot bibimbap and sullongtang. The bibimbop was sizzling from start to end which I love. The sullongtang was good but I've definitely had better. I enjoyed the freshness of their banchans and the many freebies they gave us. Although service was a bit slow, it allowed us time to figure out what to order. But it wasn't so great when trying to pay and get out of the place. My main disappointment with this place was the amount of flies around our table and others. Every time I looked around, someone was swinging their hand around to keep the flies from getting near their food. Our table alone had about 5-7 flies. It really ruins your appetite!
author: Lee N.

description:
came here for lunch extremely on empty and hungritos and left completely stuffed!

ordered the spicy beef bulgogi and bi bim bap.  the bulgogi was a huge portion and was so juicy and flavorful. i believe it was about $20 which struck me as a bit pricey at first, but once we tasted it and received all the banchan, it was extremely worth it. the bi bim bap was delicious!! it was about $11. the burnt rice at the bottom of the stone pot was my favorite..and of course everything else about it! they also had an egg in it and the bi bim bap i usually get at another place in santa clara had never offered it. they had the spicy sauce you usually eat it with but no oil. it's ok, preventative measures in reducing heart attacks hahah. 

we had about 11 plates of different banchan that was completely authentic, home-made, and sooo yummy!! these were the best side dishes i've had by far up here and i was really impressed by the variety. apart of that was a tofu soup and on top of that was some lettuce and a red bean paste. their menu overall is very extensive and you can even bbq at your table!

for the place being half empty at the time we went, i'd say service was a little slow. parking is difficult in this area so expect to drive around a bit to find street parking.

they offered us fermented rice for "dessert." it was so sweeeet and was a great way to end our meal. i enjoyed it a great deal and thought that for once, this compared to all the great korean places they have in socal. wlll be coming back if ever in the area!

overall i'd give it a 4.5!
author: Tiffany C.

description: A couple of my friends and I came here a few days ago for dinner after work. I was warned in advanced that if there were tour buses in front of this restaurant then we might need to go somewhere else because it would be pact. When we arrived, there were indeed a couple of tour buses but one of them was leaving. Luckily, we only had to wait 20 minutes before we got our table. Parking seems to be hard to find but we got lucky and found a spot right outside the restaurant. We sat at a BBQ table (one with a grill) and ordered 4 items.  We had the: marinated grilled short-ribs, marinated beef, kimchi pancake, and rice cakes. I loved all the dishes but enjoyed the pancake and rice cakes the most.  The beef tasted good at first, especially when we wrapped it around the lettuce that was given to us with some of the side dishes.  However, after awhile the meet became dry and a little tough to chew. I really enjoyed the rice cake when it was hot and fresh because the sauce was so good along with the soft bland tubes of rice cake.  It's a very good combination.  In addition, the kimchi pancakes were very flavorful and we can taste the kimchi.  It's slightly crunchy on the outside and soft of the inside.  If you let it sit a little then it becomes soft. Overall, the experience was very good and the food is very good.
author: Anh W.

description: This is is solid. Coming from New York the price is pretty ridiculous in comparison, but the service and the food is decent.
author: Matthew K.

description: I give these guys 5 stars because it is so far the best korean restaurant I've tried here in San Francisco.  Not only the food is good but the price is also good.  I love their mong-bean pancake and sides!
author: Vanessa E.

description: Honestly, the food is mediocre and service is awfully slow.  Nothing really special about this restaurant. The menu is about the same as brothers. I had the bbq chicken, chap chae, and kimchee soup. It came with extra soup, panchan dishes, and little condiments. They tasted good though but very tedious. It's a mom and pop restaurant. I wasn't excepting any fancy food but I want some good mom-pop, home made kinda food. I was a little disappointed. I really want to like this restaurant but it didn't leave me a good impression.
author: Michael K.

description:
my gf & i have a joke of calling this place han2kwan, or h2k. it just sounds cooler that way.

h2k is one of the all time best places i've been for korean in SF. i've tried almost everything on the menu, several times, and it never lets me down.

the only drawback to h2k is that it's in the cuts, and parking sucks. i recommend you take the bus if you want to get here: 31-balboa or 38-geary (or 5-fulton if u really want to walk it off)
author: Greg A.

description: I've been coming here for over 15 years now!  That alone says something about this place.  The pan chan is really good in both freshness and variety.  I usually get the kalbi, jap chae, yuk gae jang(spicy beef noodle soup).  I love the mung bean pancakes here.  The sun dobu jigae used to be better when they put oysters in it...but everything else is solid.  I usuually let them do the cooking for me cause I can never seem to do it any better adn your clothes will end up smelling less.  Only thing is parking can be a problem here sometimes.
author: Amina B.

description: Good solid Korean food.  Lots of options, well-executed.  Clean place, polite service.  Really enjoyed the grains tea.  Yum.  Perhaps too much food but nothing I didn't like.  Oh yes, parking BAD. Got a $90 ticket...and SF continues to murder their middle class.
author: Beth C.

description: Another Korean joint with average food, though the prices for BBQ seemed a bit lower than the usual suspects (Brothers, etc). Not for BBQ purists -- the grills here are gas instead of wood charcoal. The squid bokum was pretty good here. The mayuntang was forgettable. Not crowded on a Sunday night.
author: Sunny Y.

description: Love this place.  It's usually half empty and it doesn't reek of smoke like most Korean BBQs.  I think their kimchi chigae rivals My Tofu House, one of my favorite restaurants. Service is awesome. I've seen busloads of Korean tourists file in for dinner while we were there and there was no interruption in our service.   Great place to go in the IR without the wait that you might get at Brothers #2.
author: cindy m.

description: OMG, OMG, OMG!!! Foodgasm! I LOVE this place. First, the decor: it's got the outside inside thing going on, with little sloped Japanese style roof tiles and beams slanting in, and little red lanterns hanging down. The booths are spacious, and the center is filled with smaller tables (no grills), and there are also two or three big party rooms in the back. Yes, we had to wait for about 40 minutes, but I think that's a sign of a good restaurant. Once we sat, we didn't wait long for our food, and I was thrilled that they brought out about 15 little dishes of Korean appetizers to try while we waited (complimentary with every meal), tiny fried fish, kim chee, bean curd, and lots and lots of veggies, prepared in different ways: YUM. Then they brought the meat- we ordered marinated chicken and beef and cooked it right there at the table (it smelled sooooo good!) We wrapped it up with rice in the large lettuce leaves they brought us. They also brought us some spicy tofu soup that was really good, and apparently complimentary. I don't know if it was extra or what, but it was nice that it landed on our table. At the end they bring you little rice dessert drinks, which were also delicious but I could barely get down because I was so stuffed. Note: they make you order two BBQ items if you sit at a table with a grill, which is a LOT of food for two. When they served us I immediately understood why everyone we watched eat before us had so many take home containers.
author: Sara B.

description: I discovered this gem when my friend from Boston was visiting and demanded good Korean food. I tried it and will definitely go back. It was soo good. I love their Kalbi, it was very tasty.
author: L R.

description:
Han Il Kwan quickly became one of my favorite Korean places.  I finally got my Korean food fix here.  I first came here months ago for a friend's birthday and really like the food.  Thanks to Yelp, I was able to find this place again.

My fiancee and I ordered a really simple meal of BiBimBop and Spicy Pork.  Along with the myriad of side dishes, the restaurant also brought us a mildly spicy tofu soup on the house.  We had way more food than we bargained for and had to take some home.  The spicy pork was really good and the bibimbop was everything it should be.  I felt like I was eating home cooked Korean food.  

I will be here more often whenever I need to get my Korean food fix.
author: Scott L.

description: I think I almost drowned in the amount of food that came at once. We had a large group and ordered 2 dinner Bs...we waited for a bit but when the tide of food it, it didn't seem like it was ever gonna stop! a few waiters were come in and out of the room nonstop and the table was completely filled. The BBQed meats were good but other things like the steamed eggs and the things that look like little egg pancakes were tasteless. The wait staff was not very attentive but we were too occupied with the food to care. I think i'd like to be seated in the outside dining area next time because it was kind of stuffy in the back room..
author: meL Z.

description: I was a Brothers regular until a friend convinced me to take a chance on this out-of-way gem a few months back.  The BBQ is great, as is the Bi Bim Bop.  I don't require much else for a great Korean dinner so this was enough to convince me.   Bonus, no waiting on the painful Brothers lines.    Haven't been to Brothers since trying this place.  Although, I must say that I have some misgivings about helping to spread the word...
author: Jason M.

description: did the bbq and my shirt still smells great!
author: Mike B.

description: I'm actually a huge fan of this place! I'm not so keen on anything but the weekday lunch special. That said, their lunch specials are SUPER affordable (esp when you consider the fact that Korean food is usually pretty expensive). Also, the service is typically pretty good. Ironically, the only reason I dropped it a star is that on one occasion they had a Korean Tour in for lunch (be warned, whenever you see a big bus in front of the place it'll likely be really full) and they turned us away! It was kind of shocking, esp since we had been there so many times and I knew they waitress recognized us. But overall, I'd still come back for the bulgolgi and kalbi beef!
author: Simon L.

description: Good for large and small group. But it needs a better service. When it gets busy, the servers miss orders, give wrong orders, forget to bring kimchi/napkin/water after asking for them. The location is hard to find parking. Always make sure to reserve before going or will have to wait for a long time. But despite all the above, it has one of the best Korean Food in town. And always give free soup/steam egg/pancake.
author: Man Kit Y.

description:
Have you ever had a sigmoidoscopy?  It's quite literally a pretty shitty experience.  First you have to be on clear liquids for 2 days.  Then you have to drink a whole gallon of nasty salty solution which then keeps you up all night because you are running to the bathroom every 5 minutes, purging your bowels until there is nothing left to purge.  Then your doctor snakes a camera up your nether region and pumps your colon full of gas, giving you the worst gas cramps ever, then you spend the next 6 hours farting it all out.
But there is a silver lining - after enduring this whole horrible ordeal, you can go binge yourself at Han Il Kwan and eat all the kalbi and bulgogi you want because lets face it, you've got alot of empty space in your stomach to fill.  Deliciously marinated meats and a plethora of side dishes can be enjoyed in a bright, non-smokey dining room.  Prices are fair for the amount of food you get - along with about 10 side dishes, meals also come with rice, tofu soup, and a sweet rice drink for dessert.  Be forwarned though, service is on the slow side so don't come here if you've got somewhere else to be.  But overall, it was a great way to reward my tummy for enduring the past few days and most of all, to celebrate not having colon cancer.  Yay!
author: Cindy W.

description: When I went, 8:30-ish on Friday, there were no tour buses in sight. Parking was rough. I though the little dishes (9 for 2 of us) were very good, the "Korean pancakes" they gave us were hot and crispy, and the steamed egg custard hot and fluffy. I made a stragegic error in ordering the dolsot bibimbap as "soy bean sprouts and vegetables over rice" and not checking whether it was vegetarian. It turned out to have a bunch of beef, which I picked off.  But I have only myself to blame. My dining companion had a seafood etc soup which he reported was good and not too salty.
author: Amy E.

description: I've been coming here for ten years, it's a spot I take all my friends to and they love equally as much. Good food, plenty of it, super nice people who know me when I come in. The only thing to avoid is to go when the tour buses come which is on the weekends during lunch time but otherwise, if you can get past the crowd (and can you blame them, the food is good!), the place is so worth it. I start going here after getting really bad service from a local known Korean BBQ place and haven't looked back since. A must go!
author: Natasha C.

description: You will smell like BBQ so wear your jeans and t-shirt. It's all good!
author: Tina L.

description:
hands down, the best korean food in the city.  right when you order enough food for your party, they throw in 1 or 2 free dishes (varies from an egg dish, to tofu, to bi bim bap).

i've never had to wait more than 30 seconds, and if you don't want to smell, the kitchen can cook your meat, and it is still very very good, plus you don't smell.

not a date place, it's kinda cheesy inside, but definitely a place you come with your friends to grub.
author: Jason J.

description:
this is my go-to destination when i'm craving korean.

very extensive menu - bonus!

best bi bim bap i've ever had. it blows my mind, a total dreamboat!

incredible seafood pancakes and kimchee bean cake. 

last time i was there, i ordered the oxtail soup - disappointing, surprisingly. the meat wasn't as tender as it should be (wasn't cooked long enough), and the broth, which looked like miso (but wasn't), was very bland. 

my friend had the cold noodles. fun to eat - a novel tactile sensation. slimey, sticky, flavorful. we joked that it was like eating live octopus (a la oldboy). 

a bit pricier than say...tofu house (another fave), but a nice overall experience. huge booths - perfect for spreading out after diving into a paralyzing food coma.
author: jennifer y.

description: Thanks to Nang-Keo, the birthday girl, and Eugene, her sweetheart friend from G-tech, we had the perfect large group birthday meal last week. I'm a fan of Korean bbq as well as the tofu stews and banchan. Since people were mostly dressed up (not me as i came directly from gym) so smokin' our own meats wasn't an option. better if the pros in the back grill it anyhow, that's my opinion. The spicy pork rocked, and so did the bulgogi. That lovely Eugene took care to order "one of each" mostly so we really should've brought our own lazy susan from a chinese banquet hall. Seafood pancakes and onion pancakes were delicious in the dipping sauce, sweet and tangy. Jap chae also had nice mushrooms and noodles in a perfectly seasoned sauce. they replenished tea and rice all the time, so we were in Kbbq heaven!
author: Ron W.

description:
my favorite korean restaurant.  i realy like their lunch specials.  such a good deal.  they have the best side dishes.  

came here for my birthday.  we ordered one of the dinner specials, 2 bbq items, one bottle of soju.  i never ordered anything but the bulgogi and kalbi so this was a treat.  i love the seafood dishes.  

parking sucks here. and be careful not to come here when the tour bus is parked outside.   

good prices, plenty of seating.  only do the bbq yourself if you have guests who have never had korean bbq.  otherwise, it will just be easier if they cook it cuz you don't want the smoke to burn your eyes.  plus if you have to q a lot the grill thingy turns black really fast and they have to keep changing it.  don't wear nice clothes here if you are grilling cuz it will smell.  

and don't eat here if you are going clubbing otherwise you will burp and people will smell the food you just ate.  it's kinda gross!
author: D W.

description: One of the best Korean restaurants in the bay area! It's right in the middle of a residential neighborhood, way out there, but the food always takes great--the BBQ beef, the side dishes, the tofu stew. If you like Korean food, you won't be disappointed.
author: J K.

description: Excellent, genuine Korean. Service concepts were borrowed from a military boot camp: sit, order, eat, pay, shut up. It's a bit odd to arrive at a near empty restaurant to be told that you will have to wait for 10 minutes to get a table. The mystery was resolved when a large tour bus pulled up and about 70 Korean tourists came into the restaurant.  15 minutes later they have eaten and left. Seafood soup was outstanding, side dishes superb.excellent local eatery. Not a place to propose.
author: Yuri V.

description: I, along with pretty much everyone else at my table, ordered #29 - bi bim bap.  It was awesome.  I'd never had anything in a stone pot before, and this was definitely a great first experience!  My boyfriend, ever the non-conformist, ordered the rice cake soup with meat dumplings.  The few spoonfuls I tried were equally as good as my bi bim bap.  I admit that I'm usually a little sketched out by the quality of meat in dumplings -- but I found nothing to complain about here!  The waiter was enthusiastic and prompt, even with a large table of 7 people.  A perfect meal on a cold, rainy night.
author: Anna R.

description: Drool! I'm hungry just thinking about this place!! I absolutely LOVE this place! They have the best variety of side dishes, such as the green onion pancake with the yummy sauce, and steamed eggs (so good), amongst the usual delicious items. The service and food quality is way better than Brothers and the restaurant is not too smoky from the BBQ. They also have banquet rooms for private parties which a nice touch!
author: Annie L.

description: Yummy food but parking is tough around here.  This place has some sort of agreement with the tour bus co. as you often see loads of Koreans getting dropped off here.  I wonder what they think about this place...  I was brought here for my birthday and although they didn't have seaweed soup that day, they made me a big ol' bowl!  KK heart HIK!
author: Kim K.

description:
i like coming to this place although parking is a bitch, especially at night.

i basically order the same three dishes everywhere i go. some kind of tofu soup, beef/pork bulgolgi and jap chae. i feel like those three dishes is a good litmus test for the kitchen. the bulgolgi here is flavorful and stays moist. i've gone to places where the meat gets dried out within minutes! i also love how they have plenty of veggies in their jap chae, it's not just all noodles. they also give you plenty of banchan and one of the favorite reasons i like to come here -- the complimentary egg dish. it's soft and just melts into the rice. 

prices are reasonable, food is good. what more can you ask for? :)
author: sasa w.

description: My husband and I stumbled upon this place about 2 years ago.  Unfortunately since we live in the South San Jose area we don't get up here too often, but when we do I love to get their kimchee pancakes.  The kimchee tofu soup was great too and we are not huge fans of tofu -- it was super smooth like silk and soft in texture.  The side dishes were good, but nothing stood out that was fantastic...if you go, get the kimchee pancakes!
author: Catherine E.

description: Good food at reasonable prices.  Loved the complimentary dishes.   The service was good and also cute too boot.  The place was busy for a weekend  without requiring a long wait.  Will be back for more.
author: Curtis A.

description: This is San Francisco's Korean Tour Bus' Official Restaurant and you know what that means.  The food must be good.  You will see large crowds out here often and also Korean Tour buses too and the tour guides are probably getting a fat kickback for bringing the tourists here but deservedly so.  One of the better Korean places in the city....  Tasty Meats and Korean Side dishes.....
author: Mark W.

description: this place is nice, we went during the week and the wait wasn't much of a problem. parking is tough. the restaurant it self is clean and not too crowded. we're both from l.a. and had korean bbq before so this place had to live up to high expectations. it did for the most part. we cooked at our table which i would suggest to everybody coming to a korean bbq, its so much fun. the banchan isn't the best, i guess we're spoiled with l.a. the meat was just as good if not better. prices were on the higher side, but its worth it. all i can say is that both of us had a good time and left satisfied.
author: Joey H.

description: This was some tasty and very authentic Korean food. I ordered the rice dish in the sizzling stone pot just because I love how the rice gets after it cooks and gets crunchy and infused with all the flavor. The servings of meat that I saw at the other tables were gynormous. There were a ton of tasty little dishes served with the meal, and two free dishes: a spicy tofu soup and some refreshing cinnamon ginger pine nut water for a dessert. Can't beat that.
author: Shannon R.

description: Han Il Kwan is probably one of the best Korean restaurants in the city so far.  I'm always trying out different Korean restaurants, and yup, this place is pretty up there.  Side dishes are always fresh and mouth-watering.  Always a great combination of spicy, bitter, and sweet side dishes.  However, I had to knock off one star because, the service is quite slow.  While there seems to be enough waitresses at any one shift, I feel like I'm not even there becuase it takes them forever to notice someone is sitting there with their menu closed and folding their chopstick paper into pretty knots, waiting for someone to take their order.  But....I don't even care about the bad service because the food is too good.
author: Mellie P.

description:
oh yeah, its all true, they go above and beyond to hook you up at this place. even if you only got an entree for 8.95. and I couldn't decide if it was cute or kind of silly that the waitress kept saying "on the house" for literally every dish she put down. 

tasty. diverse flavors. daikon radish kim chi was dope. 
not totally thrilling though, yknow like the ppq on 19th is.
author: Jeremi M.

description: Bulgogi like mom makes. In fact,a  few kinds of bulgogis. Great kimchichige, and bean sprout cakes were also tasty. Good for groups!! Random that I ever say that, I have to say. MOre randomness... I was there for a birthday party, and the private room next door was laughin ga LITTLE too loud. We were laughing in competition. Later on realized what they were laughing about... someone got an erotic cake. Two-boob cake, with very realistic red raspberry veins that was just disgusting.
author: Anna B.

description: Wow, I am surprised everyone is giving this restaurant such high marks.  Maybe I am spoiled after going to Korea?  Anyhow, I love bi bim bop, and here it just isn't that good.  Not many vegetables in the dish.  The lunch specials are a really good deal, however.  Also, they give "service" (free dish if you order quite a few things).  The panchan is really good here, as is the bulgogi.  However, if you're craving Korean, this is a good place to satisfy your craving.
author: Sarah F.

description: The food here is good.  BBQing at our table was cool.  The side dishes were interesting and I began to chump away at each of them.  I noticed there were quite a few unknown sides that tasted ok.  Well if it looks good, eat it right?, as Andrew Zimmern said. =).  The Jap Che was the bomb when it's nice and hot.  The default soup with tofu is quite appetizing.  Made me hot along with the Jap Che.  I didn't want to soup myself out nevertheless the BBQ chicken, beef and seafood were very flavorful and delicious.  I would definately recommend this place if you like some good ass korean food!
author: Charles E.

description:
Even though it was a bit of a mission to find this place due to misinformed directions on our part, this place was quite the discovery.

They are really quite generous with the sides, unlike other places I have been to in the past, and the service was also quite helpful.  Really good bibimbap and kimchi.  Definitely gonna want to hit up this place again.
author: Joel J.

description:
The first time I came here, I thought this place was pretty good and possibly could've been an alternative to Brothers when they get busy. 
 
And because of my lovely first experience, I suggested this place for my friend's 21st birthday.  We ordered bul go gi and the spicy pork for BBQing.  The side dishes are incomparable to Brothers.  

I would've given this place 4 stars if it weren't for the expensive dok bokki i ordered.  It was SUPER SUPER SUPER mushy with nothing other than some green onions sprinkled on top.  No fishcakes, nothing! And they charged 10 bucks for it.  ARGH! 

I might be back.  

P.S. Don't order pancakes because they give you small pancakes as a side dish anyways.  I ordered the kimchi pancake.  Nothing kimchi about it, outside was nice and crispy, and the inside tasted like uncooked batter.  Gross.
author: Emily L.

description: Living in SF it was hard for me to find a cheap Korean restaurant. One day I passed by this restaurant and decided to give it a try for lunch. I noticed that the prices were cheap and as the food came out the portions were pretty big. They give you a lot of side dishes as well as non-stop refills when you run out and the service is great. My favorite is the Spicy BBQ Pork.
author: Isaac B.

description: I went there for the 2nd time in one month, I knew about this place since 5 years ago and one of the main reason I don't go there is because it is very very hard to find a parking spot. Last night when we went there was parking in front of the restaurant but it was for tour bus parking and I saw other cars parked there so I parked there since it is Sunday and I believed that tour bus parking is for this restaurant anyway. So while I was eating I saw a old guy was writing down all the license plate numbers parked at the tour bus zone, not wanting to have a parking ticket I went outside and asked him what was the problem and he turns out to the guy live next to the restaurant and said well you guys are not supposed to park here it is a tour bus zone and you need to move. Pissed off at him but I got no choice what if he calls the DPT and they came give me a ticket so I moved my car which is about 3 blocks away (I ended up order one more meat), anyway back to the review the food is great, I especially liked their BBQ meat which tastes much better than Brothers and other Korean restaurants I have been to so far. But ther side dishes are lack of varieties. Their seafood pancake (number 40 on their menu) is below average and their kimchi chege is the worst, maybe it is because the restaurant was full at the time and there were only two people working at the front. Anyway I would go back again for the BBQ meat.
author: William C.

description: i've never seen so many korean people here in my life.. actually i've never seen so many korean people overall.  but bus after bus of korean tourist were coming in here the night i was here.. the food here is ok. they give you so many of those small side korean dishes that it's so easy to get full really quick.  however, i found there Jap Che too oily for my stomach. their dishes are pretty big and i had to take most of the food home.  if you are looking for a  place for a group of friends 10 or more this place will be good, and parking will be easier compare to the other korean restaurants for big groups.
author: Belinda C.

description: Probably my worst experience ever at a Korean place! I made sure to tell the waitress the spicy dishes were to be cooked mild...but sure enough it came out spicy as hell! And service was lacking. Every time I needed something, I had  to flag someone down and then have it brought back at a snail's pace. The place wasn't even that packed! Never going back!
author: Wendy L.

description: We arrived around 7 and the tour bus crowd had taken over the place.  After a 1/2 hour wait we sat down at a table with a grill - this is a must.  Order the bulgogi and spicy pork (raw) they bring out to grill --- mmmm!  The kim-chee extravaganza that fills the table is delicious.  Oh yeah... make sure you plan on going home to change after this meal.  The smoke that engulfs the table while grilling likes to work its way into your clothes!
author: Josh D.

description: Situated out kind of in the midskirts of the balboa corridor, HIK serves up some tasty korean fare.  Yah, good.  Their pan chan is tasty -- by far the most tasty thing is the fluffy egg thing that comes -- I'm not sure how to ask for that if they don't bring it though.  but it was good.  Man, they must do a lot of dishes at korean restaurants.  I wonder if they have a special Hobart for all the little panchan plates.  But yah, it's good.  When were there, there were like four policemen there eating their dinner there too, so we felt nice and safe, or something.  Korean fud, good.   Yah.
author: Dennis Y.

description: so good...so good!!! My bf and I ordered the cook-in and felt like a stuffed turkey afterwards. We just could not bear to leave good bbq and side dishes uneaten even though we passed our belly treshold. Bring friends if you're gonna do the cook-in.
author: Iche S.

description: i thought the food was tasty! i love how there's so many side dishes! my favorite was that pancake thing but you can only have one free order...(what can i say i am asian i like free stuff). but we did the korean bbq and i thought the meat was really good. it wasn't 99% fat and 1% meat like all the other places. also this is where all the korean ppl from korea comes to eat during their tour of SF! so it must be delicious!
author: Victoria C.

description: I go here at least 3 times a week.  The lunch specials are very reasonably priced, but the cooked-too-dry-for-you-barbeque kind of sucks.  I haven't tried it self-cooked yet.  The short-rib casserole dish , though, is heavenly.  A big perk of this place is the panchan includes a tofu soup as well as mung-bean cakes.  Service is friendly most of the time.  I wish they didn't leave the doors open because I don't enjoy sharing my food with flies.
author: Tokki M.

description:
Love this place.

For the quality of food, and the quantity, as well. And I'm not talking about just the food that i order...i mean also the free food you get with your order! I know, I know, I'll probably go bald (korean joke) liking all this free stuff, but I know  you guys like it too....free egg in dolsot, mini pancake...and even soon tofu!

I tried the seafood dol sot, gal bi jjim, soon tofu, mackerel, and intestine soup. All very flavorful and wonderful. 

The only thing is I feel bad that there's always food left over...even if i order only one thing for myself! There's just too much for my little stomach to digest in one sitting...The servers there always say in Korean, "Eat alot" when they serve...which is something polite to say in Korea. And I kind of feel bad since I never seem to meet their expectations. 

Still! I'm going back! :)
author: Nayeoung K.

description: Recommended by a friend to try this place out and I'm glad we did! Great food, efficient service and a hidden gem in the Richmond district. Lots of tasty condiments and sides and the bee bim bop was yummy and so was the Kalbi and chicken. We didn't want to smell of BBQ, hence they cooked for us inside the kitchen. The rice soup drink was great to wash everything down after the lovely meal.
author: Yan M.

description:
Delicious crack...everything on the menu must be filled with some sort of crack to get me craving the food here every week.  The bibimbap [sp?] with beef is delicious! Everything is delicious. Granted that most items are over $10, but the side dishes more than make up for the price. There's more food than I can handle!

On a good day, you could probably hear people in a nearby  table or booth making sweet sweet love to their food...literally. The last time I was there, I swear the guys at the table behind me were have orgasms.

You may want to come before 7pm or after 8pm to avoid the bus loads of tourists.  High recommended.
author: Fresca T.

description:
Wow...this must be some popular place with all those tour buses coming by to drop off the tourists for lunch and dinners.  One huge group was already dining here when we arrived.  So it must be decent K-fare.  
This is also the 1st time I ever bbq-ed/grilled our own food--in a K-restaurant that is.  We usually order it to be cooked in the kitchen for the prices we pay.  So if you don't like to work for your dinner then thats the way to go.  But this can be a great way to socialize at the same time with a decent sized group.  They have exhaust fans so you don't smell so bad when you leave but  do be aware.
They have soju if you drink the stuff like me.  The meats are well  seasoned and they give you plenty of panchan =side dishes.  The tofu donjoobu is pretty good although not very spicy.  You can ask for more kimchi or other condiments.  Overall, this place is well maintained and the food is good.  I'd come back but would prefer not to cook my own dinner...even though I am a darn good chef!
author: Eric Y.

description: Me and my friends took a road trip to SF just to have dinner from the South Bay.  We were thinking Thai, but then another friend already had Thai that day, so we decided on Korean since we haven't had it in a while.  This place had a great menu.  Not many items on the menu was vegetarian, but they do have vegetarian stuff.  We got the tofu soup, kim chee pancakes, and crispy rice pot thing.  They brought out a lot of side dishes and gave us everything including the non vegetarian items.  This is good cause only two of us at the table was vegetarian.  The food was good.  They gave us a lot of "on the house" items, which is a big plus and an extra star.  At first we got some other pancake thing and thought, that's it for $12, three pieces?  It was one of the many items they provided on the house turns out.  I won't say no to that (unless it was non veg of course).  Everything is all and well, but afterward, I did get hella thirsty.  The food probably had a lot of sodium or yikes, MSG?  I hope not.  It didn't bug me like MSG would, so I think it's probably just a lot of sodium.  I would go back again if we were in the area and in the mood for Korean, but I will make sure I get water too instead of just tea from the get go.  "On the house" stuff FTW!
author: Andrew N.

description: Been here twice now, its been good both times. I really like to frequent mom and pop places, and this is a little family that just runs the place.  They have very good portions. The staff is quite friendly, and even offered to cut or meat when we were cooking it. However, they are a little slower than most of the Korean places. What I like the most about it is the fact that I seem to always be able to find a parking spot around there! This place is wonderful!
author: Christina O.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed the food & service.  I counted 9 panchan sides, along with the complimentary onion pancake & egg custard which could have been a meal in itself.   Mandoo (steamed dumplings) was interesting with the inclusion of chap chae noodles-not typical.  Refreshig shikeh (a sweetened rice drink) was served at the end of the meal in a small paper cup which I thought was a little tacky, considering the rest of the meal had been served with ceramic plates/bowls.  Although Saturday's lunch prices were a little bit steep for a kalbi or bulgogi entree, I'll be back.
author: Al L.

description: I'm all about variety and I like it here because they've got a tasty and wide selection of panchan.  So it's still a party even if it's just two of you.  My favorites of the panchan are the mung bean cakes and the egg custard.  And all of the main dish standards - dol sot bi bim bap, jap chae, kalbi, bulgogi, and soon doo boo jji gae are pretty good too.  But beware, go wearing elastic or don't order too much.  The two times I was there, I was stuffed silly just halfway into the meal.
author: Pelle Y.

description: What could be better than warm/hot Korean food on a cold, cold night? I like this place because the food stays on just the right side of spicy and tasty, meaning that it's not overpowering in either department. Sometimes, it's even a little sweet and that's a nice surprise. Also, it doesn't really ever get smoky in here. The last thing I want is to smell like the food I've just eaten, so that's another plus this place has going for it. Only downside is that like a lot of other Korean restaurants, this one's a little pricey. Still, in a large enough group (you'll need one, to finish most of the food anyways) that doesn't become much of a problem.
author: Philip W.

description: The banchan was okay, but the bulgogi was great. The bacon sucked. I'm pretty sure it was 60% fat and not in the delicious-but-hella-unhealthy way. The service was pretty good. I did not care much for the decoration. This poster of Lee Hyori got all up in my face as I was heading to the bathroom.
author: Anna Y.

description: Yum korean food!!  Its hard to go wrong here.  They also have a few options that I haven't seen at other Korean restaurants.  Be aware that Korean tours drop off their patrons to eat at this restaurant, which sometimes results in a bit of a wait.
author: linda d.

description: After eating here countless times, I figured I better write a review.  Great Korean food, like other reviewers have said, companied by fast, polite service.  They give a generous variety of side dishes, about 9-10 per table, and also throw in a free dish if you have more people.  Dinner is followed up with a sweet rice drink.  Thats more than I can say for other Korean restaurants in the city.  Parking does suck, but this is San Francisco, parking always sucks.
author: Swirls L.

description: I'm a cheap bitch, and a lot of the Korean restaurants I've checked out in the city require BBQ, so there's kind of a set price right there. It was good that I discovered this place because 20 bucks for dinner is just too much. Anyway, I ordered the Dol Sat Bi Bim Bap, which came at an okay price, and it also came with Banchan. Oh yeah, and the soup was supposedly on the house. Everything tasted very new to me because I've never officially have been to a Korean restaurant until I came to this one. The desert was either tofu or rice submerged in some sweet water. This place has kind of reshaped my price logic because I've actually been to restaurants that cost more with much less food, so I will keep in check next time I go to another Korean restaurant.
author: Alex Y.

description: Other than having been ignored by the staff most of the night, we really enjoyed our dinner here.  The food is good and moderately priced in terms of Korean cuisine. Our food came out quick and hot with a couple of extras we didn't order that helped us to forgot about the struggle of getting our servers' attention.
author: Deanna T.

description:
i went here  for dinner the other day. i swear, our waitress was like a robot. she was just programmed to take orders and serve food. she didnt crack a smile whatsoever! but she was nice. 

 the first time my boyfriend and i came here, we cooked our food at the table.  **FYI, you must order two items in order to cook food at the table.** we didnt wanna order two items cause it was too much food. so we just ordered off the menu.  their food is really good! kind of pricey but  delicious. if you like korean food, then come here and try their food.
author: B B.

description: I came here with a friend 2 years ago and remembered how good it was so I took my fiance here last week.  Everything was good...down to the kimchee :)  I will definitely come back if ever I'm in the area.
author: Rose E.

description: Came here for lunch with my friends today. I had the seafood over rice in a sizzling platter. It was delicious. I liked the crunchy parts of the rice on the sides of the bowl. Only bad thing was it sticks to my teeth. It's very generous in size because I had leftovers for to go. I tried my boyfriend's grilled rib's. It was pretty tasty but I liked my dish more. The side dishes weren't as tasty as the one's from Brother's but the decorations of the place exceeds Brothers. The price for a lunch is pretty reasonable. Maximum was about $9-10. The service was friendly. Definitely a place I would come back to.
author: Audrey M.

description: As you walk down the street towards this restaurant, the pleasant sweet aroma fills your nostrils enticing you to come in for a bite.  When we walked in, the place was bustling.  We got lost in the shuffle for a sec but once we were seated and had ordered the food came almost instantly.  Our food was served with little "side dishes" comprised of pickled vegetables, lettuce, and sauces.  Everything tasted simply amazing and I was suprized that such a wonderful restaurant was tucked away in the outter richmond district.  This is definately a place to go eat, drink, and take your time and enjoy.
author: Yasmine D.

description: ANNYONG!!! This has got to be one of the best places to go get Korean food since the atmosphere is really friendly and comfortable. I've only been here twice but I would so go there again when I'm in the neighborhood
author: Maile W.

description: We had a large party so had the room in the back for about 15 of us.  They have vent hoods here but still cooked all the meat for us first, which is actually kind of a good thing with such a large party, no one wants to get stuck bbq-ing for everyone.
